title: Coffee Day shares hit 10% upper circuit for 2nd day, 20 Microns surges 8% as Dolly Khanna buys stake
content: The shares of Coffee Day Enterprises jumped 10 percent to hit the upper circuit for the second consecutive day, while 20 Microns shares rallied 8 percent on July 16. This comes after the latest shareholding patterns showed that veteran investor Dolly Khanna has bought some stake in the two firms. Coffee Day Enterprises shares were locked in the 10 percent upper circuit at Rs 39.86 apiece, while 20 Microns shares were trading at Rs 243 apiece. The well-known Indian investor hails from Chennai and is known for picking small and mid-cap stocks that often become multi-baggers. Her portfolio is managed by her husband Rajiv Khanna. Khanna held 32.78 lakh shares, representing 1.55 percent stake in the parent company of popular chain Café Coffee Day, according to BSE data showing the firm's shareholding pattern as at the end of the April-June quarter. The corresponding shareholding data for 20 Microns, the producer of industrial minerals, showed that Khanna held nearly 7.03 lakh shares representing 1.99 percent stake in the company, as at the end of June. Her name was not present on the shareholding patterns of the two companies at the end of the previous quarter (January-March). This can mean that she bought fresh stake in the two firms during the period. This can also mean that she earlier held less than 1 percent stake in the two firms, which didn't require any disclosures, and bought more shares during the quarter which took her stake higher than 1 percent. The rise in the share prices today came on the back of heavy trading volumes. Nearly 85.26 lakh shares of Coffee Day have been involved in active trade so far, as seen at 11 am. This is nearly 11 times higher than its 10-day average volumes. Around 10 lakh shares of 20 Microns have been traded so far, which is over 8 times higher than its 10-day average volumes. Coffee Day Enterprises shares have now rallied nearly 16 percent in the past five days, and over 46 percent in the past six months. The stock is currently up over 68 percent in 2025 so far. 20 Microns shares meanwhile gained over 1 percent in the past one month, and nearly 7 percent in the past six months. The stock is currently up over 2 percent in 2025 so far. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Shilpa Medicare shares surge 4 percent as key unit gets a VAI classification from US drug regulator
content: Leading API and formulations maker Shilpa Medicare's Bengaluru unit has received an Establishment Inspection Report (EIR) from American drug regulator USFDA, with a Voluntary Action Indicated (VAI) classification, implying the company is expected to respond with corrective measures to address the issues, sending the shares higher by over 4 percent on escaping an immediate regulatory action. The inspections were conducted in October last year. "Shilpa Medicare Limited, Unit VI, Dabaspet, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India has received EIR with VAI (Voluntary Action Indicated) classification, from USFDA, for the GMP inspection which was conducted from October 24 – 30, 2024," the company filing said. Shilpa Medicare's facility in Bengaluru is capable of manufacturing, packaging, testing, storage and distribution of two types of complex dosage forms - Oral Dissolving Films and Transdermal Systems, said the company. A transdermal patch is a medicated adhesive patch placed on the skin to deliver a specific dose of medication through the skin and into the bloodstream. These have made their way into the global market as an alternative to conventional, non-invasive, painfree method of administering medicines. Similarly, the oral thin film drugs have high market acceptance due to ease of use and effectiveness. The US and Europe have recorded significant sale of oral thin film drugs. The unit already has several other drug regulators, including Europe, UK, Saudi Arabia and Australia. In February this year, the unit had received certification for Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) from Saudi Arabia's drug regulator SFDA. The same unit is supplying Oral Film products to US and other markets, and Transdermal products to the European market. The management said it is confident of launching a transdermal patch in EU 'sometime in Q4FY26 tentatively or Q1FY27', adding that this is a segment where not many companies are working on it globally. For the Rotigotine patch - used to treat symptoms of Parkinson's disease - the company has projected a global market over EUR 200 million, and has partnered with a 'strong' European player for the segment. On a YTD basis, the shares of Shilpa Medicare are up 15 percent, and over last one year, the share are up 44 percent.
summary_lexrank: "Shilpa Medicare Limited, Unit VI, Dabaspet, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India has received EIR with VAI (Voluntary Action Indicated) classification, from USFDA, for the GMP inspection which was conducted from October 24 – 30, 2024," the company filing said.
summary_luhn: Leading API and formulations maker Shilpa Medicare's Bengaluru unit has received an Establishment Inspection Report (EIR) from American drug regulator USFDA, with a Voluntary Action Indicated (VAI) classification, implying the company is expected to respond with corrective measures to address the issues, sending the shares higher by over 4 percent on escaping an immediate regulatory action.
summary_lsa: In February this year, the unit had received certification for Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) from Saudi Arabia's drug regulator SFDA.

title: Coromandel Int to pay final dividend of ₹6.00, ex-date due tomorrow
content: Coromandel International has announced a final dividend of ₹6.00 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, July 17, 2025. The stock rose 2.3% in today's trading to Rs 2,399.5. This followed a fall of 1.65% in the previous session. The announcement provides an opportunity for investors to receive dividend income, while the ex-date determines eligibility for the dividend payout. Investors who hold the stock until today, July 16, 2025, will be entitled to receive the dividend.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹6.00Ex-DateJuly 17, 2025Coromandel International's financial performance for the year ending March 2025 shows a revenue of Rs 24,085.24 crore, an increase compared to the Rs 22,058.39 crore reported in the previous year. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 2,108.15 crore, also higher than the Rs 1,667.17 crore recorded in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 70.23 from Rs 55.81 in the prior year, and the book value per share (BVPS) increased to Rs 376.37 from Rs 320.88. The Return on Equity (ROE) stood at 18.63%. The company’s quarterly financial results reveal that revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 4,988.39 crore, compared to Rs 3,912.72 crore in the same quarter of the previous year. Net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 595.10 crore, compared to Rs 174.06 crore in the same quarter of the previous year, and EPS was reported as Rs 19.70. According to the yearly income statement, the company's sales for the year ending March 2025 were Rs 24,085 crore, compared to Rs 22,058 crore for the year ending March 2024. Other income for the same period was Rs 358 crore, compared to Rs 231 crore for the year ending March 2024. The company's net profit stood at Rs 2,108 crore compared to Rs 1,667 crore, and total expenditure at Rs 21,400 crore, compared to Rs 19,888 crore. The company's balance sheet for the year ending March 2025 showed total assets of Rs 18,927 crore, compared to Rs 15,851 crore in the previous year. Equities and liabilities amounted to Rs 18,927 crore compared to Rs 15,851 crore. The company’s cash flow from operating activities stood at Rs 2,463 crore. Key financial ratios for the year ending March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 70.23, a book value per share of Rs 376.37, and a dividend per share of Rs 15. The company’s debt to equity ratio stands at 0.02.

title: Inox Wind to consider rights issue of equity shares, board meeting due tomorrow to mull fundraising
content: Inox Wind Ltd board is scheduled to meet tomorrow - 17 July 2025 - to consider rights issue of equity shares and other fundraising proposals. Inox Wind Ltd shares fell 0.6% today to Rs 163.8, extending its previous day's 6.7% fall. The stock has lost more than 7% in two days. Inox Wind has a market capitalization of 26,610 Crore. The decision regarding the rights issue carries significant implications for Inox Wind’s capital structure and future growth prospects. A rights issue allows existing shareholders to purchase additional shares, typically at a discounted price, thereby raising capital while giving current investors the opportunity to maintain their proportional ownership in the company. The terms, including the ratio and premium, are yet to be determined, pending the board's deliberation. From a financial standpoint, Inox Wind has demonstrated notable improvements in its performance. According to the consolidated yearly data, the company's revenue surged from Rs 1,743.23 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 3,557.15 Crore in March 2025. The net profit also saw a significant turnaround, moving from a loss of Rs -50.78 Crore in March 2024 to a profit of Rs 437.62 Crore in March 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) followed a similar trend, rising from Rs -1.56 to Rs 2.77 during the same period. Quarterly performance data reveals consistent growth in revenue and net profit. Revenue increased from Rs 527.73 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 1,274.82 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also climbed from Rs 36.72 Crore to Rs 190.34 Crore over the same period, reflecting enhanced operational efficiency and market demand.Consolidated Yearly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)MetricMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue3,557.151,743.23736.98624.62710.73Net Profit437.62-50.78-670.70-429.80-280.69EPS2.77-1.56-20.58-19.37-13.84In terms of balance sheet strength, Inox Wind has shown improvements. Share capital increased from Rs 325 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 862 Crore in March 2025, indicating capital infusion. Total assets stood at Rs 8,795 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 6,794 Crore in the previous year. The debt-to-equity ratio decreased from 1.91 in March 2024 to 0.29 in March 2025, showcasing a healthier financial leverage position. The cash flow statement reveals that the net cash flow turned positive in March 2025, with Rs 8 Crore compared to Rs -9 Crore in March 2024. This positive shift is primarily attributed to changes in operating, investing, and financing activities. The board meeting outcome regarding the rights issue will be crucial for shareholders and potential investors, as it will determine the extent of equity dilution and the company's financial strategy moving forward. The details of the rights issue, when announced, will provide further clarity on Inox Wind's strategic direction.

title: Axis Bank board to consider quarterly results tomorrow
content: Axis Bank's board meeting, scheduled for tomorrow, July 17, 2025, will address the quarterly results. The was trading at Rs 1,164.8 in the late morning session on Tuesday, down 0.09% from the previous close. Investors will closely watch the bank's financial performance amid current market conditions. The upcoming board meeting gains significance as stakeholders anticipate insights into Axis Bank's financial health and strategic direction. The bank's performance in key metrics such as revenue, net profit, and earnings per share (EPS) will be crucial in assessing its growth trajectory and operational efficiency. As per the latest available data, Axis Bank has demonstrated steady growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. In the quarter ending March 2025, Axis Bank reported a revenue of Rs 32,452 crore, compared to Rs 30,230 crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 7,489 crore, slightly lower than the Rs 7,613 crore reported in March 2024. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 24.14, showing a marginal decrease from Rs 24.63 in March 2024. These figures provide a glimpse into the bank's recent financial performance, which will likely be a key focus during the board meeting. Looking at the yearly consolidated data, Axis Bank has shown robust growth. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 127,374 crore, a significant increase from Rs 112,759 crore in the previous year. The net profit also saw substantial growth, reaching Rs 28,115 crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 26,427 crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 90.72, up from Rs 85.62 in the previous year. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) also increased to Rs 604.50 in March 2025 from Rs 508.73 in March 2024. The Return on Equity (ROE) stood at 14.98% in March 2025, slightly lower than the 16.80% in March 2024. The Net Interest Margin (NIM) improved to 3.40% in March 2025 from 3.38% in March 2024. Here’s a summary of Axis Bank's yearly financial performance:Axis Bank Yearly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)MetricMar 2025Mar 2024YoY ChangeRevenue127,374 Cr112,759 Cr+13.0%Net Profit28,115 Cr26,427 Cr+6.4%EPS90.7285.62+5.9%Additionally, the bank's balance sheet indicates a strong financial position. As of March 2025, the Share Capital stood at Rs 619 crore, and the Reserves & Surplus were Rs 185,433 crore. The Deposits reached Rs 1,170,920 crore, and the Borrowings were Rs 220,686 crore. The Total Liabilities amounted to Rs 1,656,962 crore. On the assets side, Loans & Advances were Rs 1,081,229 crore, and Investments were Rs 396,685 crore. The Gross NPA stood at 1.28%, and the Net NPA was 0.33%. The Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR) was 17.07%. The meeting will also address other key performance indicators, strategic initiatives, and future outlook. Investors and market analysts will keenly observe the outcomes of the board meeting to gauge the bank's future prospects and investment potential.
summary_lexrank: In the quarter ending March 2025, Axis Bank reported a revenue of Rs 32,452 crore, compared to Rs 30,230 crore in March 2024.
summary_luhn: In the quarter ending March 2025, Axis Bank reported a revenue of Rs 32,452 crore, compared to Rs 30,230 crore in March 2024.
summary_lsa: The upcoming board meeting gains significance as stakeholders anticipate insights into Axis Bank's financial health and strategic direction.
summary_textrank: The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 127,374 crore, a significant increase from Rs 112,759 crore in the previous year.

title: PDS to pay final dividend of ₹1.70, ex-date due tomorrow; last day today to trade shares
content: PDS has announced a final dividend of ₹1.70 per share, ex-date due tomorrow, July 17, 2025. The announcement was made on May 15, 2025. The company's last traded price was ₹387.80, a decrease of 0.18% compared to the previous day's closing. PDS's market capitalization stands at ₹5481.15 Crore. Analyzing the company's recent financial performance, the revenue for the year ending March 2025 was ₹12,577.99 Crore, compared to ₹10,372.65 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was ₹242.29 Crore, up from ₹196.50 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to ₹11.44 from ₹10.98. For the quarter ending March 2025, PDS reported revenue of ₹3,525.77 Crore and a net profit of ₹74.28 Crore. This compares to revenue of ₹3,215.18 Crore and net profit of ₹60.80 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024. The EPS for the quarter ending March 2025 was ₹2.66.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹1.70Ex-DateJuly 17, 2025Historically, PDS has demonstrated a consistent dividend payout. The dividend per share for the year ending March 2024 was ₹4.75, for March 2023 was ₹5.10, for March 2022 was ₹23.85, and for March 2021 was ₹15.75. This final dividend announcement reflects the company's commitment to returning value to its shareholders. From a financial ratios perspective, the Return on Equity (ROE) for the year ending March 2025 was 9.50%, compared to 12.36% for the year ending March 2024. The Debt to Equity ratio stood at 0.67, down from 0.81 in the previous year. PDS's annual income statement shows sales of ₹12,577 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to ₹10,372 Crore for the previous year. The net profit stood at ₹242 Crore for the same period, up from ₹196 Crore. Quarterly, the sales were ₹3,525 Crore for March 2025 compared to ₹3,215 Crore for March 2024, with net profit figures at ₹74 Crore and ₹60 Crore, respectively. The company's balance sheet indicates that as of March 2025, the total assets were ₹4,738 Crore, and total liabilities were ₹4,738 Crore. Key balance sheet figures include share capital of ₹28 Crore and reserves & surplus of ₹1,622 Crore. In terms of cash flow, the net cash flow for the year ending March 2025 was ₹99 Crore. This compares to a net cash flow of -₹157 Crore for the year ending March 2024. With the last traded price at ₹387.80, PDS showcases financial growth reflected in increased revenue and net profit, along with a continued commitment to rewarding shareholders through dividends.

summary_lsa: This compares to a net cash flow of -₹157 Crore for the year ending March 2024.

title: Hold HCL Technologies; target of Rs 1693: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on HCL Technologies Q1FY26 revenue came in at INR 3,03,490 Mn. (+0.3% QoQ /+8.2% YoY), in-line with our estimates (+1.8%), driven continued growth traction across Financial services, Technology and Telecom segments. USD Revenue stood at 3,545 Mn. (- 0.8% QoQ CC/ +3.7% YoY CC), performed better than our expectations of -1.9% QoQ CC growth. Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation to Jun’27 estimates. We value HCL Tech at 23.0x Jun’27 EPS (at +1 SD to 7-year avg NTM P/E), implying a target price of INR 1,693. HCL Tech is currently trading at a 1-year fwd. P/E of 24.0x (in-line with its 1- year Avg. NTM P/E). We reiterate our “HOLD” rating on the stock. title: Vodafone Idea shares rise 2.35% in Wednesday's trading session
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea gained 2.35% to trade at Rs 7.84 on Wednesday. The stock movement is part of trading session, with the scrip currently trading on the NIFTY MIDCAP 150. title: Adani Ports shares gain 1.72%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Adani Ports were trading higher in Wednesday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,469.90, a 1.72% increase. The stock emerged as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index at 10:30 am. Other top gainers on the Nifty 50 included HDFC Life (1.09%), Wipro (0.99%), HDFC Bank (0.73%), and Adani Enterprises (0.65%).Financial Snapshot of Adani PortsThe following tables provide a summary of the key financial figures for Adani Ports, both quarterly and annually.Quarterly FinancialsHere’s a look at the consolidated quarterly performance of Adani Ports:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 6,896.50 CroreRs 7,559.59 CroreRs 7,067.02 CroreRs 7,963.55 CroreRs 8,488.44 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,049.51 CroreRs 3,184.39 CroreRs 2,414.01 CroreRs 2,467.04 CroreRs 2,854.26 CroreEPS9.4414.4111.3211.6713.95The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 8,488.44 Crore, compared to Rs 6,896.50 Crore in March 2024. title: Infosys shares gain in today's session; over 13.1 lakh shares traded
content: Infosys shares traded at Rs 1,593.60, up 0.50% in Wednesday's session. Around 13.1 lakh shares were traded on the NSE. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue saw fluctuations over the recent quarters. For the quarter-ending March 2024, revenue was Rs 37,923.00 Crore, which increased to Rs 39,315.00 Crore in June 2024, then further to Rs 40,986.00 Crore in September 2024, and peaked at Rs 41,764.00 Crore in December 2024. However, it slightly decreased to Rs 40,925.00 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Net profit followed a similar trend, starting at Rs 7,975.00 Crore in March 2024, decreasing to Rs 6,374.00 Crore in June 2024, then increasing to Rs 6,516.00 Crore in September 2024 and Rs 6,822.00 Crore in December 2024, before reaching Rs 7,038.00 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also varied, beginning at Rs 19.25 in March 2024, dropping to Rs 15.38 in June 2024, then rising to Rs 15.71 in September 2024, Rs 16.43 in December 2024, and Rs 16.98 in March 2025.HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 37,923.00 CroreRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 7,975.00 CroreRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreEPS19.2515.3815.7116.4316.98Consolidated Yearly Performance: The annual revenue for Infosys has shown consistent growth from 2021 to 2025. Revenue increased from Rs 100,472.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 162,990.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit also increased from Rs 19,423.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 26,750.00 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the earnings per share (EPS) rose from Rs 45.61 in 2021 to Rs 64.50 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Yearly Income Statement: The sales for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 162,990 Crore, compared to Rs 153,670 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Infosys had a stock split on January 24, 2000, with old face value of 10 and new face value of 5. Infosys shares traded at Rs 1,593.60, up 0.50% in Wednesday's session.

title: Bharti Airtel shares fall marginally today; over 7.5 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading flat in Wednesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,931.30. The stock experienced a marginal decrease of 0.15%. In today's session, over 7.5 lakh shares were traded on the NSE. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 47,876.20 Crore, compared to Rs 37,599.10 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 12,418.10 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 1,237.90 Crore reported in March 2024. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 19.02, up from Rs 3.61 in March 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth. In March 2025, the revenue reached Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a substantial increase from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw a significant rise, with Rs 33,778.30 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in the previous year. The EPS improved to Rs 58.00 in March 2025 from Rs 13.09 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel show a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 8.83 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.30 as of the year-ending March 2025. Here's a detailed look at the financial performance of Bharti Airtel:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-Rs 27.65Rs 7.67Rs 14.80Rs 13.09Rs 58.00BVPSRs 147.90Rs 164.46Rs 210.95Rs 216.40Rs 195.98ROE-25.586.399.197.3929.52Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.30Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16 per share with effective date as July 18, 2025. The company has also announced that 30th Annual General Meeting will be held on August 08, 2025. Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading flat in Wednesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,931.30.

title: ITC shares fall moderately in today's session; over 13.8 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 420.90 on the NSE at 10:20 am, a marginal decline of 0.28% from the previous close. Over 13.8 lakh shares changed hands in the session. On the financial front, ITC has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 18,765 Crore, compared to Rs 17,922.70 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same quarter stood significantly higher at Rs 19,709.47 Crore, compared to Rs 5,187.22 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 15.77, up from Rs 4.10 in March 2024. Analyzing the yearly consolidated performance, the revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 75,323.34 Crore, up from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in the previous year. The net profit stood at Rs 19,926.05 Crore in March 2025, slightly lower than Rs 20,723.75 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 27.79 in March 2025 from Rs 16.42 in March 2024. Here is a detailed look at ITC's key financials:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 202149,272.7813,389.8010.70Mar 202260,668.0915,485.6512.37Mar 202370,936.8519,427.6815.50Mar 202470,881.0020,723.7516.42Mar 202575,323.3419,926.0527.79The company’s balance sheet shows that as of March 2025, the share capital stood at Rs 1,251 Crore and reserves & surplus were Rs 68,778 Crore. Total liabilities amounted to Rs 88,090 Crore, with fixed assets valued at Rs 22,148 Crore and current assets at Rs 43,893 Crore. Key financial ratios for ITC as of March 2025 include a P/E ratio of 14.74 and a P/B ratio of 7.32. The company's debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00 as of March 2025. ITC has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share was announced on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share was announced on February 6, 2025, effective from February 12, 2025. The company had a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1 per share. The company allotted 4539620 shares as per the exchange filing on July 11, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 420.90, ITC showcases a stable presence on the Nifty 50 index amid today's trading session.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares see moderate fall; over 1.9 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading lower in Wednesday's session. The stock price was Rs 2,518.10, a decline of 0.35% on the NSE as of 10:20 am, compared to the previous day's close. title: Ashok Leyland shares adjust to bonus issue: Here's why you should ignore the 50% plunge
content: Ashok Leyland's share price appeared to have nearly halved in value on July 16. The shares of the automaker dropped 50 percent in one single day, not due to a significant market crash, but as a result of its 1:1 bonus issue which took effect today. The shares are trading ex-bonus, and have adjusted their stock price accordingly. While the share price has halved, it will not bear an impact on shareholders' holdings. For example, if an investor held one share of Ashok Leyland worth Rs 100 as on the record date (July 16), he will now have two shares of the company worth Rs 50 each. This keeps the total worth of his holdings same at Rs 100. The shares of the company opened at Rs 125 apiece on NSE, marking a fall of over 50 percent from the previous closing price of Rs 251 apiece. While announcing its results for the fourth quarter of FY25 in May, Ashok Leyland had said that its board approved the issue of bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1. Later in another exchange filing, the company announced that July 16 has been set as the record date to determine the eligibility of the shareholders set to receive the payment. The bonus shares will be allotted to the eligible shareholders on July 17, and investors can trade these shares from July 18. Notably, this was the first bonus issue announced by the company in 14 years since a 1:1 bonus issue in 2011. Ashok Leyland shares dropped nearly 1 percent in trade to hover around Rs 124 apiece on July 16. The stock currently has a P/E ratio of nearly 44. In May, the company reported a 38.4 percent rise in net profit at Rs 1,246 crore in the fourth quarter of FY25, on the back of decent revenue growth and robust sales. The company had posted a profit of Rs 900 crore in the fourth quarter of FY24. Its revenue from operations rose 5.7 percent to Rs 11,906.7 crore during the quarter. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: While announcing its results for the fourth quarter of FY25 in May, Ashok Leyland had said that its board approved the issue of bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1.
summary_luhn: While announcing its results for the fourth quarter of FY25 in May, Ashok Leyland had said that its board approved the issue of bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1.
summary_lsa: Ashok Leyland shares dropped nearly 1 percent in trade to hover around Rs 124 apiece on July 16.
summary_textrank: Later in another exchange filing, the company announced that July 16 has been set as the record date to determine the eligibility of the shareholders set to receive the payment.

title: Trent shares extend gains as Canada's Lululemon picks Tata CLiQ for India debut
content: Shares of Tata Group’s Trent Ltd rose by over a percent on July 16, extending their winning run for a second straight session, after Lululemon — the Canadian athleisure major — announced plans to enter the Indian market. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty. The brand is set to open its first physical store in India in the second half of 2026 and has partnered with Tata CLiQ for both its brick-and-mortar and digital presence. Lululemon’s products will be available through Tata CLiQ Luxury and Tata CLiQ Fashion, bringing its high-performance apparel, footwear, and accessories to Indian consumers. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates “The partnership will bring lululemon’s innovative athletic and lifestyle offerings to India, supporting a wide range of activities like yoga, training, running, tennis and golf,” CNBC TV-18 reported, citing an official comapany release. Tata CLiQ, part of Trent’s digital commerce ecosystem, houses over 4,000 fashion brands and more than 15 lakh product styles. It falls under the umbrella of Westside, Trent’s flagship retail chain. The announcement comes at a time when Trent’s online business is gaining momentum. According to HDFC Securities, e-commerce contributed 6 percent to Westside’s revenue, with volume growing 41 percent in FY25. Also read: India trade deal to be along same lines as Indonesia-US, says Trump In its latest quarterly update, Trent said its revenue grew 20 percent year-on-year in the June quarter—lower than its five-year CAGR of 35 percent. Despite this, last week, Bernstein maintained its outperform rating on the stock, citing that the long-term growth story remains intact. The brokerage noted that the company's Q1 update confirmed a 20 percent year-on-year revenue growth, but believes this should not be seen as the new normal. At about 10 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 5,430, higher by 0.7 percent from the last close on the NSE. Trent shares are down 25 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The brand is set to open its first physical store in India in the second half of 2026 and has partnered with Tata CLiQ for both its brick-and-mortar and digital presence.
summary_luhn: The brand is set to open its first physical store in India in the second half of 2026 and has partnered with Tata CLiQ for both its brick-and-mortar and digital presence.
summary_lsa: Tata CLiQ, part of Trent’s digital commerce ecosystem, houses over 4,000 fashion brands and more than 15 lakh product styles.
summary_textrank: The brand is set to open its first physical store in India in the second half of 2026 and has partnered with Tata CLiQ for both its brick-and-mortar and digital presence.

title: Patanjali Foods shares rise 2.10% today, ahead of board meeting to mull bonus issue
content: Shares of Patanjali Foods gained 2.10% to trade at Rs 1,781.20 in Wednesday's session. The stock movement reflects a positive shift from its previous close, with the gains placing the stock among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 as of 9:52 am. Patanjali Foods board of directors is due to meet tomorrow (17 July) to consider a bonus issue of shares. Financial Performance: Patanjali Foods' financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 34,156.97 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 1,300.71 Crore. Here is a summary of the company's financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS201630,240.49-1,306.56-39.01201719,172.89-1,361.78-46.08201812,027.05-5,748.27-172.70201912,729.23-87.97-0.32202534,156.971,300.7135.94The company's revenue increased significantly from Rs 12,729.23 Crore in 2019 to Rs 34,156.97 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a turnaround, from a loss of Rs 87.97 Crore in 2019 to a profit of Rs 1,300.71 Crore in 2025. Net profit also increased from Rs 39.95 Crore to Rs 358.52 Crore over the same period. Balance Sheet: The company's balance sheet shows a strong position with increasing equities and liabilities. title: Coromandel International shares rise 2.02% in early trade
content: Shares of Coromandel International gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 2,393.20 in Wednesday's early session. The stock movement is positive compared to its previous close. At 09:44 am, the stock is trading among the top gainers on NIFTY MIDCAP 150. Looking at the company's financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,988.39 Crore, compared to Rs 3,912.72 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 595.10 Crore, up from Rs 174.06 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS increased to Rs 19.70 in March 2025 from Rs 5.45 in March 2024. The consolidated yearly revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 24,085.24 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 22,058.39 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2,108.15 Crore, up from Rs 1,667.17 Crore in the previous year. title: Nifty 50 top gainers: Trent, Tech Mahindra, HDFC Bank stocks lead index in today's trading
content: In Wednesday's early trading session, several stocks showed positive momentum on the Nifty 50. Trent shares led the gains, trading at Rs 5,450.00, reflecting a 1.11% increase. Tech Mahindra shares followed, priced at Rs 1,591.80, up by 0.81%. HDFC Bank shares also saw an uptick, trading at Rs 2,009.20, a 0.69% rise from its previous close. SBI shares traded at Rs 818.40, up by 0.24% and HCL Tech shares were at Rs 1,568.50, showing a 0.13% increase. Trent Ltd Trent Ltd has scheduled a board meeting on August 6, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. The company's board had earlier announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share, with an effective date of June 12, 2025. The company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus ratio announced on September 21, 1996, with an ex-bonus date of October 22, 1996. Additionally, the company had a stock split on June 28, 2016, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1, with the ex-split date being September 12, 2016. Here is a summary of Trent's financial performance:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 17,134.61 CroreRs 12,375.11 CroreRs 8,242.02 CroreRs 4,498.02 CroreRs 2,592.96 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,447.91 CroreRs 1,353.89 CroreRs 310.22 CroreRs 29.46 Crore-Rs 109.77 CroreEPSRs 43.51Rs 41.82Rs 12.51Rs 2.98-Rs 4.11The company’s revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 17,134.61 Crore, an increase from Rs 12,375.11 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,447.91 Crore, compared to Rs 1,353.89 Crore in the previous year. Tech Mahindra Tech Mahindra announced a final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share on April 24, 2025, which went into effect on July 4, 2025. The company’s board is actively involved in investor meets and earnings conference calls, as indicated by recent announcements. Tech Mahindra’s financial highlights are detailed below:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 52,988.30 CroreRs 51,995.50 CroreRs 53,290.20 CroreRs 44,646.00 CroreRs 37,855.10 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,244.40 CroreRs 2,386.30 CroreRs 4,886.00 CroreRs 5,627.30 CroreRs 4,351.80 CroreEPSRs 48.00Rs 26.66Rs 54.76Rs 63.32Rs 50.64The company’s revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 52,988.30 Crore, slightly up from Rs 51,995.50 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,244.40 Crore, compared to Rs 2,386.30 Crore in the previous year. HDFC Bank HDFC Bank recently scheduled an earnings call regarding the unaudited financial results for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. The bank announced a final dividend of Rs 22.00 per share on April 21, 2025, which was effective from June 27, 2025. SBI State Bank of India (SBI) has scheduled a board meeting on July 16, 2025, to consider raising funds for FY26 through Basel III compliant capital bonds. The bank's board had earlier announced a final dividend of Rs 15.90 per share, with the effective date being May 16, 2025. HCL Tech HCL Tech's board has set July 28, 2025, as the payment date for its interim dividend. The company has a history of rewarding shareholders with consistent dividend payouts. On July 14, 2025, HCL Tech announced an interim dividend of Rs 12.00 per share, effective from July 18, 2025. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 17,399 Crore, compared to Rs 15,710 Crore in the previous year.

title: ITC shares fall marginally in early trade
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 421.55 on the NSE, down 0.13% in Wednesday's session. The stock's movement reflects a slight decrease from its previous close. The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of ITC:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 17,922.70 CroreRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,187.22 CroreRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreEPS4.104.083.993.9515.77The company's revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 18,765.00 Crore, slightly less than the Rs 18,790.17 Crore in December 2024. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 19,709.47 Crore. The EPS increased to 15.77 in March 2025 from 3.95 in December 2024. The following table presents the consolidated yearly financial performance of ITC:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 75,323.34 Crore compared to Rs 70,881.00 Crore in March 2024. However, the net profit saw a slight decrease to Rs 19,926.05 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 20,723.75 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to 27.79 in March 2025 from 16.42 in March 2024. ITC announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025. The company had allotted 4539620 shares, according to an announcement on July 11, 2025. Shares of ITC were trading down 0.13% in Wednesday's session.

title: Apar Industries shares rise 2.12% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Apar Industries gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 9,232 in Wednesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, reflecting positive investor interest in early trade. Financial Performance: Apar Industries has demonstrated consistent financial performance, as evidenced by its annual results. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 18,581.21 Crore, compared to Rs 16,152.98 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 821.42 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 825.72 Crore recorded in the year-ending March 2024. The company's earnings per share (EPS) for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 204.47, while the book value per share (BVPS) was Rs 1,121.12. The return on equity (ROE) stood at 18.23% for the year-ending March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio remained stable at 0.10. The following table summarizes the key financial metrics:Financial MetricMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)6,388.029,319.9914,352.1516,152.9818,581.21Net Profit (Rs Crore)160.50256.61637.74825.72821.42EPS (Rs)41.9467.09166.64212.10204.47BVPS (Rs)368.23448.19584.37965.011,121.12ROE (%)11.3814.9628.5121.2818.23Debt to Equity0.150.150.140.100.10Additionally, Apar Industries' consolidated quarterly revenue for March 2025 reached Rs 5,209.76 Crore, up from Rs 4,455.11 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 250.03 Crore, compared to Rs 236.21 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 62.23.Financial MetricMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)4,455.114,010.524,644.514,716.425,209.76Net Profit (Rs Crore)236.21202.54193.85175.01250.03EPS (Rs)60.9750.4248.2743.5562.23Corporate Actions: Apar Industries has announced a final dividend of Rs 51 per share (510%) with an effective date of July 29, 2025. The company had also announced final dividends of Rs 51 per share in the previous year with effective date of August 20, 2024. The company had earlier issued bonus shares in the ratio of 1:3, with the ex-bonus date being January 11, 2007. Also, company had rights issue with ratio of 1:3, and exrights date being April 03, 1995. Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bullish sentiment on Apar Industries as of today.

title: ICICI Prudential shares fall 4% as weak topline, persistency slide disappoint brokerages
content: Shares of ICICI Prudential fell 4 percent to Rs 643 per share on July 16 as the company reported a decline in annualised premium equivalent (APE) growth, short-term persistency ratios, and investment income. Brokerages were not impressed by the June quarter results but expressed hope that higher traction in non-linked products could support profitability in the future. So far this year, the life insurer’s stock has slipped 0.6 percent, underperforming the Nifty 50 benchmark index, which has gained 5 percent in the same period. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Morgan Stanley maintained an "Equal-Weight" rating on ICICI Prudential Life with a target price of Rs 625 per share. It highlighted muted APE growth, weak persistency, a sharp drop in annuity APE, and margin pressure as negatives. On the positive side, the brokerage noted strong growth in protection business and effective cost control. VNB margin came in at 24.5 percent, close to their estimate of 24 percent. However, lower product margins despite a higher protection mix was flagged as a concern. Morgan Stanley forecasted 8 percent APE and VNB growth for FY26 and 13 percent VNB growth for FY27. Motilal Oswal, on the other hand, reiterated its "buy" rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 780 per share. It expects that operating leverage, continued cost optimisation, better traction in non-linked products, and improved product-level margins will support profitability going forward. While analysts kept its APE growth estimates unchanged for FY26 and FY27, it raised VNB margin estimates by 100 basis points for both years, factoring in the Q1 FY26 performance. ICICI Prudential reported a 34.2 percent year-on-year increase in net profit at Rs 302 crore for the June quarter, up from Rs 225 crore in the same period last year. However, the value of new business (VNB) declined slightly to Rs 457 crore from Rs 472 crore in Q1 FY25. The VNB margin improved to 24.5 percent from 24 percent. APE fell 5 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,864 crore, impacted by a 9.5 percent drop in savings APE. On the persistency front, the 13th-month persistency (by premium) declined to 80.8 percent from 85.7 percent in Q1 FY25. On the other hand, longer-term persistency improved: the 25th-month ratio rose to 82.5 percent from 79.5 percent, and the 49th-month ratio improved to 69.8 percent from 68.2 percent. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Shares of ICICI Prudential fell 4 percent to Rs 643 per share on July 16 as the company reported a decline in annualised premium equivalent (APE) growth, short-term persistency ratios, and investment income.
summary_luhn: On the other hand, longer-term persistency improved: the 25th-month ratio rose to 82.5 percent from 79.5 percent, and the 49th-month ratio improved to 69.8 percent from 68.2 percent.
summary_lsa: Shares of ICICI Prudential fell 4 percent to Rs 643 per share on July 16 as the company reported a decline in annualised premium equivalent (APE) growth, short-term persistency ratios, and investment income.

title: Sensex down 150 pts, Nifty below 25,150 as auto, metal stocks fall; small, midcaps rise for 3rd day
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex were off to a weak start on July 16 as sentiment soured after US President Donald Trump threatened fresh tariffs on pharmaceuticals and semiconductors. The delay in the India-US trade deal has added to the pressure in the recent sessions, dragging down investor confidence. Auto and metal stocks were the major drags, while the broader market gained marginally. At about 9:30 am, the Sensex was down 117.59 points or 0.14 percent at 82,453.32, and the Nifty was down 45.25 points or 0.18 percent at 25,150.55. About 1655 shares advanced, 751 shares declined, and 147 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "The inflation increase, partly attributed to Trump's tariffs, has also dampened sentiment and has put imminent pressure on Fed to decide if rates are to be slashed," Devarsh Vakil, Head of Prime Research at HDFC Securities said. Experts also add that tariff letters issued by Donald Trump to countries has also added to anxiety. Markets opened on a mixed note Wednesday, with sectoral indices showing a largely range-bound trend. The India VIX edged up 1.05 percent to 11.60, indicating a slight rise in volatility. Among sectoral movers, Nifty PSU Bank rose 0.42 percent. Nifty IT, Consumer Durables, and Midcap 100 also posted modest gains. On the flip side, Nifty Auto slipped 0.75 percent, while Metal and Infra indices saw marginal declines. Nifty FMCG, Oil & Gas, Realty, and Private Bank indices were largely flat in early trade. Also read: India trade deal to be along same lines as Indonesia-US, says Trump Among individual stocks, Dixon Technologies rose over 3 percent after it signed a binding term sheet to acquire a majority 51 percent stake in Kunshan Q Tech Microelectronics (India) Pvt. Ltd. The move, part of a mix of primary and secondary investments, will give Dixon access to advanced technology and precision manufacturing in camera and fingerprint modules — key components used in smartphones, IoT devices, and automobiles. Read more: For Q1, past will outshine present as life insurers brace for soft FY26 Multiplex operator PVR INOX Ltd slipped over a percent on Wednesday, July 16, after the Karnataka government proposed a cap on movie ticket prices at Rs 200 each. The rule would be applied across theatres in Karnataka, from single-screen operators to large-scale multiplexes. Further, it would include all entertainment taxes. According to the draft, the public has around 15 days to respond to the proposal. PVR INOX is yet to officially respond. HDFC Life gained 2 percent after the private insurer posted stable June quarter performance. Brokerages were bullish on the counter and projected up to 20 percent potential upside from here on. HSBC shared a "buy" call for HDFC Life and shared a target price of Rs 900 per share. Morgan Stanley also shared an "overweight" rating for HDFC Life with a target price of Rs 840 per share. A reasonable positive candle was formed on the daily chart with a minor upper shadow. Technically, this market action indicates an attempt to bounce back from near the lower support levels of around 25,000. Further sustainable upside from here could confirm the short-term bottom reversal pattern for the market. The bounce back of Tuesday could be a cheering factor for the bulls to make a comeback. A sustainable move above the immediate resistance of 25350 could open more upside in the near term. Immediate support is placed at the 25,000 levels. Trent, HDFC Life, Tech Mahindra, SBI Life Insurance, and HDFC Bank were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Shriram Finance, Tata Steel, M&M, Cipla, and JSW Steel. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Dixon Tech shares rise 4% as CLSA, Nomura turn bullish on new acquisition and JV
content: Shares of Dixon Technologies rallied as much as 4 percent to Rs 16,450 in morning trade on July 16 after it signed a binding term sheet to acquire a majority 51 percent stake in Kunshan Q Tech Microelectronics (India) Pvt. Ltd. The move, part of a mix of primary and secondary investments, will give Dixon access to advanced technology and precision manufacturing in camera and fingerprint modules — key components used in smartphones, IoT devices, and automobiles. Q Tech India is backed by Q Technology (Singapore) and Kunshan Q Technology International, both entities within the larger Q Tech Group. Dixon expects the acquisition to deepen its expertise in high-value components and contribute to India's growing electronics supply chain. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates In a separate development, the company also announced plans to form a joint venture with Chongqing Yuhai Precision Manufacturing Co. Ltd., with Dixon set to hold a dominant 74 percent stake. The JV will focus on manufacturing precision parts for laptops, mobile devices, connected devices, and automotive applications. The partnership is expected to sharpen Dixon’s competitive edge in high-precision engineering and broaden its footprint across diverse product categories. Following the development, Nomura has maintained a Buy rating on Dixon Technologies with a target price of Rs 21,409 per share. This implies an upside potential of 35 percent from the last close. The brokerage sees the company's entry into the camera module business through its stake in Q Tech India as a key value addition. It believes Dixon's move to expand into both camera modules and precision components could lead to a 5 percent upside in earnings per share (EPS). The separate 74:26 joint venture with Chongqing Yuhai marks the company’s formal entry into precision components manufacturing. Also read: Trump says Indonesian goods to face 19% tariff under trade deal, no tax on US exports CLSA has reiterated its High Conviction Outperform call on Dixon, with a target price of Rs 19,000 per share. It notes that the company is taking significant steps to increase value addition in smartphones, especially through camera modules and precision enclosures. When combined with its existing JV with HKC, Dixon’s value addition in smartphones could rise from 15–17 percent to as much as 45–55 percent. CLSA also expects this to improve margins by 150–200 basis points and open up new external revenue opportunities. Dixon Technologies' share price is down 12 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Following the development, Nomura has maintained a Buy rating on Dixon Technologies with a target price of Rs 21,409 per share.
summary_luhn: Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates In a separate development, the company also announced plans to form a joint venture with Chongqing Yuhai Precision Manufacturing Co. Ltd., with Dixon set to hold a dominant 74 percent stake.
summary_lsa: It notes that the company is taking significant steps to increase value addition in smartphones, especially through camera modules and precision enclosures.
summary_textrank: The move, part of a mix of primary and secondary investments, will give Dixon access to advanced technology and precision manufacturing in camera and fingerprint modules — key components used in smartphones, IoT devices, and automobiles.

title: Bharti Airtel shares gain marginally in Wednesday's session
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,936.20 on the NSE, up 0.10% from the previous close, at 9:20 am. Financial snapshot: Bharti Airtel's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue. The quarterly revenue has increased steadily, with the revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 standing at Rs 47,876.20 Crore, up from Rs 37,599.10 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw a significant rise, reaching Rs 12,418.10 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 1,237.90 Crore in the same quarter of the previous year. The EPS has increased to Rs 19.02 in March 2025 from Rs 3.61 in March 2024. The yearly revenue has shown a substantial increase, climbing from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 Crore in 2025. The net profit has improved significantly, with Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025 compared to a loss of Rs -23,327.90 Crore in 2021. The EPS has also risen, from Rs -27.65 in 2021 to Rs 58.00 in 2025. Recent announcements include compliances related to SEBI regulations, newspaper publications for the 30th Annual General Meeting to be held on August 08, 2025, and the incorporation of a step-down wholly-owned subsidiary. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share with effective date as July 18, 2025. Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel show a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 8.83. title: Dixon Tech, Godrej Ind stocks jump over 3%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Dixon Technologies and Godrej Industries stocks emerged as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index in Wednesday's trading session. At 09:30 am, Dixon Technologies was trading at Rs 16,356.00, a gain of 3.37%, while Godrej Ind was at Rs 1,159.00, up by 3.32%. Other notable gainers on the index included Biocon, KPR Mill and One 97 Paytm. Dixon Technologies (India) Ltd Financial Performance Dixon Technologies (India) Limited's financial data provides a detailed overview of its performance over the past five years. The company has shown consistent growth in revenue and net profit, reflecting its strengthening market position and operational efficiency. Here’s a summary of the key financial highlights: Consolidated Financial Results (Quarterly) The quarterly financial performance of Dixon Technologies reveals significant revenue and net profit trends. Here’s an overview of the consolidated quarterly results:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 4,657.97 CroreRs 6,579.80 CroreRs 11,534.08 CroreRs 10,453.68 CroreRs 10,292.54 CroreNet ProfitRs 94.49 CroreRs 132.26 CroreRs 409.10 CroreRs 212.65 CroreRs 461.19 CroreEPS16.3123.3568.8236.1277.59The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 10,292.54 Crore, compared to Rs 4,657.97 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 461.19 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 94.49 Crore reported in March 2024. Consolidated Financial Results (Yearly) The yearly financial performance provides a broader perspective on Dixon Technologies’ growth trajectory. Key highlights include:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,448.17 CroreRs 10,697.08 CroreRs 12,192.01 CroreRs 17,690.90 CroreRs 38,860.10 CroreNet ProfitRs 159.79 CroreRs 190.39 CroreRs 253.46 CroreRs 364.68 CroreRs 1,215.20 CroreEPS27.4932.3142.9262.84205.70BVPS125.89168.04215.72288.04499.62ROE21.6719.0719.8821.6936.39Debt to Equity0.210.460.140.090.07From 2021 to 2025, revenue increased from Rs 6,448.17 Crore to Rs 38,860.10 Crore. The net profit also saw a substantial rise from Rs 159.79 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,215.20 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the book value per share has risen from Rs 125.89 in March 2021 to Rs 499.62 in March 2025. Corporate Actions Dixon Technologies (India) Ltd has scheduled a board meeting on July 22, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Additionally, the company has arranged a conference call on the same day to discuss the financial results. Dixon Technologies (India) Limited has entered into a binding Term Sheet with Chongqing Yuhai Precision Manufacturing Co. Ltd. The company has announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (250%) with an effective date of September 18, 2024. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 16,356.00, Dixon Technolog is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares fall in early trade
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading at Rs 3,239.10 on the NSE, down 0.41% in Wednesday's session. The stock price experienced a decrease of Rs 13.20 from its previous close. Financial Snapshot: Here is a summary of Tata Consultancy Services's financial performance:headingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27The revenue for Tata Consultancy Services has shown slight fluctuations over the last five quarters, with a recent revenue of Rs 63,437.00 Crore in Jun 2025. Net profit has also varied, with the latest figure being Rs 12,819.00 Crore. The EPS has seen a marginal increase, reaching 35.27. Corporate Actions Tata Consultancy Services has been actively making corporate announcements. On July 15, 2025, TCS and MIT Sloan Management Review launched a new research series, unveiling a roadmap for human-AI collaboration in enterprises. Additionally, the earnings conference call transcript for the quarter ending June 30, 2025, was announced on July 14, 2025. A copy of the newspaper publication for the financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, was announced on July 12, 2025. Dividends: The company has announced several dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share (1100%) was announced on June 27, 2025, and was effective as of July 16, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share (3000%) was announced on April 11, 2025, effective June 4, 2025. A special dividend of Rs 66.00 per share (6600%) was announced on January 9, 2025, and was effective January 17, 2025. Additionally, the company issued bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1, with the ex-bonus date being May 31, 2018. The stock's last traded price was Rs 3,239.10 in Wednesday's session.

title: Godrej Industries shares rise 2.07% in early trade
content: Shares of Godrej Industries gained 2.07% to trade at Rs 1,145 in Wednesday's early session. The stock is performing well in today's session. Godrej Industries is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. title: One 97 Communications Paytm shares rise 2.03%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 in today's trading session

Company & Market Positioning One 97 Communications Paytm is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: Bharti Hexacom shares rise 2.36% in early trade
content: Shares of Bharti Hexacom gained 2.36% to trade at Rs 1,816.60 in Wednesday's early session. The stock is a constituent of Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, the standalone annual income statement for the year-ending March 2025 shows positive financial performance. Sales increased to Rs 8,547 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 7,088 Crore in March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 181 Crore, while total income reached Rs 8,729 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 6,232 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 2,497 Crore. Interest paid amounted to Rs 688 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 315 Crore. Net profit for the year stood at Rs 1,493 Crore. title: Biocon shares rise 2.48% in early trade, hit new 52-week high
content: Biocon shares demonstrated positive movement in Wednesday's early trading session, with the stock price increasing by 2.48% to reach Rs 400.15. The stock hit a new 52-week high. This increase reflects a positive shift in investor sentiment towards the stock during the session. The stock is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the key financial data for Biocon:ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue (Rs Crore)Rs 15,261.70 CroreRs 14,755.70 CroreRs 11,174.20 CroreRs 8,184.00 CroreRs 7,105.80 CroreNet Profit (Rs Crore)Rs 1,429.40 CroreRs 1,382.00 CroreRs 810.00 CroreRs 978.50 CroreRs 925.40 CroreEPS8.468.553.885.446.24BVPS180.28210.51187.3178.8770.09ROE4.685.162.587.699.83Debt to Equity0.820.800.990.580.47The company has demonstrated consistent growth in revenue over the past five years. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 15,261.70 Crore, a 36.56% increase compared to the year ending March 2021. Net profit also increased from Rs 925.40 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 1,429.40 Crore in March 2025. The quarterly financial performance shows a revenue of Rs 4,417.00 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 3,917.10 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 459.40 Crore, compared to Rs 225.60 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. The company's income statement provides a detailed breakdown of its financial performance. Sales increased from Rs 7,105 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 15,261 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same period increased from Rs 925 Crore to Rs 1,429 Crore. Key financial ratios for Biocon show a P/E ratio of 40.39 and a P/B ratio of 1.89 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.82 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Biocon has announced a final dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (10%) with effective date 04 Jul, 2025. The company had announced bonus issues on multiple occasions, including a 1:1 bonus on April 25, 2019, with exbonus date of 12 Jun, 2019. With the stock currently priced at Rs 400.15, Biocon shows a positive trend in today's early trading session on NIFTY MIDCAP 150.

title: Dixon Technologies shares rise 2.67% in early trade
content: Shares of Dixon Technologies gained 2.67% to trade at Rs 16,245.00 in Wednesday's early session. The rise reflects a bullish investor sentiment towards the stock, as observed at 09:20 am. Financial Performance: Dixon Technologies has demonstrated substantial financial growth, as shown in the consolidated annual results. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 38,860.10 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 17,690.90 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 1,215.20 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 364.68 Crore in March 2024. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased significantly from Rs 62.84 in March 2024 to Rs 205.70 in March 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 288.04 in March 2024 to Rs 499.62 in March 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) also saw a significant increase, rising from 21.69% in March 2024 to 36.39% in March 2025. Furthermore, the company has reduced its debt-to-equity ratio from 0.09 in March 2024 to 0.07 in March 2025. Annual Income Statement (Consolidated):Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 38,860 CroreRs 17,690 CroreRs 12,192 CroreRs 10,697 CroreRs 6,448 CroreOther IncomeRs 20 CroreRs 22 CroreRs 5 CroreRs 3 CroreRs 1 CroreTotal IncomeRs 38,880 CroreRs 17,713 CroreRs 12,197 CroreRs 10,700 CroreRs 6,449 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 37,173 CroreRs 17,155 CroreRs 11,793 CroreRs 10,401 CroreRs 6,205 CroreEBITRs 1,706 CroreRs 558 CroreRs 403 CroreRs 298 CroreRs 244 CroreInterestRs 154 CroreRs 74 CroreRs 60 CroreRs 44 CroreRs 27 CroreTaxRs 337 CroreRs 118 CroreRs 89 CroreRs 64 CroreRs 57 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,215 CroreRs 364 CroreRs 253 CroreRs 190 CroreRs 159 CroreThe quarterly financial results also reflect strong performance. Revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was reported at Rs 10,292.54 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 461.19 Crore. The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 decreased by 1.53% compared to the quarter-ending December 2024. Quarterly Income Statement (Consolidated):Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Mar 2024SalesRs 10,292 CroreRs 10,453 CroreRs 11,534 CroreRs 6,579 CroreRs 4,657 CroreOther IncomeRs 11 CroreRs 6 CroreRs -5 CroreRs 8 CroreRs 16 CroreTotal IncomeRs 10,303 CroreRs 10,460 CroreRs 11,528 CroreRs 6,587 CroreRs 4,674 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 9,685 CroreRs 10,137 CroreRs 10,964 CroreRs 6,386 CroreRs 4,526 CroreEBITRs 618 CroreRs 322 CroreRs 564 CroreRs 201 CroreRs 148 CroreInterestRs 46 CroreRs 40 CroreRs 37 CroreRs 29 CroreRs 21 CroreTaxRs 111 CroreRs 68 CroreRs 117 CroreRs 40 CroreRs 32 CroreNet ProfitRs 461 CroreRs 212 CroreRs 409 CroreRs 132 CroreRs 94 CroreAccording to the consolidated balance sheet, the company's total assets have increased to Rs 16,766 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 6,991 Crore in March 2024. Cash flow from operating activities stood at Rs 1,149 Crore in March 2025. Corporate Actions: Dixon Technologies will hold a conference call on July 22, 2025, at 17:00 Hrs (IST) to discuss the Un-Audited Financial Results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The board meeting is scheduled for July 22, 2025, to consider and approve the Un-Audited Financial Results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Dixon Technologies (India) Limited has entered into a binding Term Sheet with Chongqing Yuhai Precision Manufacturing Co. Ltd. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (250%) with an effective date of September 18, 2024. The company had split its stock on Exsplit Date of March 18, 2021, with old FV of 10 and new FV of 2. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading higher, Dixon Technologies reflects positive momentum in today's session.

title: Nippon Life India AMC stock hits all-time on BSE
content: Shares of Nippon Life India Asset Management touched a 52-week high of Rs 858.05 on the BSE in Wednesday's session. At 9:22 am, the stock was trading at Rs 852, up 0.7%. Financial Snapshot: Nippon Life India Asset Management's financial performance shows consistent growth over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased steadily, reaching Rs 2,230.69 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 1,643.22 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a significant rise, reaching Rs 1,285.73 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 1,106.25 Crore in March 2024. The company’s EPS has improved from Rs 17.71 in March 2024 to Rs 20.34 in March 2025. title: ICICI Lombard shares rise as brokerages cheer healthy Q1 results
content: Shares of ICICI Lombard rose 2 percent to Rs 2,045 per share on July 16 after the company delivered a healthy performance in the June quarter. So far this year, the general insurer’s stock has gained 10 percent, outperforming the Nifty 50 benchmark, which has risen 5 percent during the same period. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Morgan Stanley maintained an "equal-weight" rating on ICICI Lombard with a target price of Rs 1,885 per share. The brokerage noted that profit after tax (PAT) was ahead of expectations due to higher investment income from capital gains. While it appreciated the company’s focus on profitable growth, it flagged limited upside at a 36-times FY26 price-to-earnings ratio, suggesting weak topline growth, intense competition, and uncertainty over the motor third-party premium hike could emerge as key risks. Motilal Oswal reiterated its "buy" rating on the stock, with a target price of Rs 2,400 per share. It expects growth to recover in FY26 and profitability to improve steadily, with the combined ratio likely to improve to 101.2 percent by FY27. PAT is projected to grow around 23 percent in FY26 and 15 percent in FY27. While the brokerage broadly maintained its net earned premium (NEP) estimates for FY26 and FY27, it raised FY26 earnings estimates by 3 percent, factoring in the strong investment gains seen in Q1 FY26. The company reported a 28.7 percent rise in net profit to Rs 747.08 crore compared to Rs 580.37 crore in the same quarter last year. Total income for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 rose 13.6 percent to Rs 6,083.3 crore, up from Rs 5,351.9 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Gross premiums written grew 1.5 percent to Rs 8,052.5 crore from Rs 7,931 crore in the same quarter last year. Net premiums written rose 4.7 percent to Rs 5,610.5 crore compared to Rs 5,360.5 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Larsen & Toubro board meeting to consider quarterly results on July 29
content: Larsen & Toubro's board of directors is scheduled to meet on July 29, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited consolidated and standalone financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Here's a summary of Larsen & Toubro's recent financial performance:Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Mar 2024RevenueRs 74,392.28 CroreRs 64,667.78 CroreRs 61,554.58 CroreRs 55,119.82 CroreRs 67,078.68 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,133.44 CroreRs 4,001.03 CroreRs 4,112.81 CroreRs 3,440.11 CroreRs 5,003.54 CroreEPS39.9824.4324.6920.2631.98The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 74,392.28 Crore, compared to Rs 67,078.68 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,133.44 Crore, up from Rs 5,003.54 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 39.98 for the quarter-ending March 2025, from Rs 31.98 for the quarter-ending March 2024. Annual Financial Highlights:20252024202320222021RevenueRs 255,734.45 CroreRs 221,112.91 CroreRs 183,340.70 CroreRs 156,521.23 CroreRs 135,979.03 CroreNet ProfitRs 17,687.39 CroreRs 15,569.72 CroreRs 12,624.87 CroreRs 10,291.05 CroreRs 4,668.96 CroreEPS109.3693.9674.5161.7182.49BVPS710.12746.01736.87678.79625.97ROE15.3915.1211.7210.5215.26Debt to Equity1.331.321.331.501.73The company's annual performance shows consistent growth. The revenue for year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 255,734.45 Crore compared to Rs 221,112.91 Crore in year-ending March 2024. Net profit also rose to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in year-ending March 2025 from Rs 15,569.72 Crore in year-ending March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 93.96 in March 2024 to Rs 109.36 in March 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) also slightly increased to 15.39 in March 2025 compared to 15.12 in March 2024. title: Wipro board meeting to consider interim dividend and Q1 results tomorrow
content: Wipro's board is set to meet to consider quarterly results and an interim dividend on 17 July 2025. The stock last traded at Rs 257.40, reflecting a 1.24% increase compared to its previous close. Investors are keenly awaiting the outcome of the board meeting, especially regarding the interim dividend. Financial Performance Wipro's financial performance over the recent quarters showcases a steady trend in both revenue and net profit. For the quarter ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 22,504.20 Cr, compared to Rs 22,208.30 Cr in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 3,559.00 Cr, up from Rs 2,878.40 Cr in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. On a quarterly basis, the net profit has shown consistent growth, from Rs 3,041.10 Cr in June 2024 to Rs 3,366.20 Cr in December 2024, culminating in the current Rs 3,559.00 Cr. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) also reflects this upward trend, reaching Rs 3.41 in March 2025.Quarterly Financial Performance (in ₹ Cr)MetricMar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Mar 2024Revenue22,504.2022,318.8022,301.6021,963.8022,208.30Net Profit3,559.003,366.203,226.303,041.102,878.40EPS3.413.216.145.755.43Analyzing the yearly data, Wipro's revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 89,088.40 Cr, slightly lower than the Rs 89,760.30 Cr in the previous year. However, the net profit saw a significant increase, reaching Rs 13,192.60 Cr in March 2025 compared to Rs 11,135.40 Cr in March 2024. The Return on Equity (ROE) for March 2025 is 15.94%, showcasing the company's efficiency in generating profits from shareholders' equity.Key Financial RatiosMetricMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021ROE (%)15.9414.8114.6118.6919.66Debt to Equity0.200.190.190.230.12Corporate Action The board's decision on the interim dividend will be closely monitored by investors, given Wipro's history of rewarding shareholders. title: Coromandel Int Ex-Date Tomorrow for Rs 3 Special Dividend; Last Day Today to Trade Shares
content: Coromandel International announced a special dividend of ₹3.00 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, July 17, 2025. The stock last traded at ₹2,345.90, declining by 1.65% compared to the previous day's close. This corporate action aims to distribute a portion of the company's earnings to its shareholders, reflecting its financial performance and stability. Coromandel International, with a market capitalization of ₹69,166.03 Crore, has shown considerable financial growth over the past few years. The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at ₹24,085.24 Crore, compared to ₹22,058.39 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period increased to ₹2,108.15 Crore from ₹1,667.17 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also saw an increase, reaching ₹70.23 in March 2025 from ₹55.81 in March 2024. These figures underscore the company's robust financial health and its ability to generate consistent profits. The dividend payout is scheduled for July 17, 2025, providing shareholders with an additional return on their investment. Dividend announcements can often influence investor sentiment, potentially leading to increased trading activity in the stock. The company's book value per share has also seen steady growth, reaching ₹376.37 in March 2025 compared to ₹320.88 in the previous year. This growth reflects the increasing intrinsic value of the company and its commitment to enhancing shareholder value. Coromandel International's financial ratios further highlight its strong performance. The Return on Equity (ROE) for March 2025 was 18.63%, showcasing the company's efficiency in generating profits from shareholders' equity. The Debt to Equity ratio remains low at 0.02, indicating a conservative approach to leverage and a strong balance sheet. These metrics are crucial for investors when evaluating the company's financial stability and long-term growth potential.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹3.00Ex-Date17 Jul 2025Payment Date17 Jul 2025The company's quarterly performance also reflects its consistent growth. The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was ₹4,988.39 Crore, while the net profit stood at ₹595.10 Crore. These figures demonstrate the company's ability to maintain profitability and drive revenue growth even in competitive market conditions.Key Financial MetricsMetricMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue (₹ Crore)4,988.393,912.727,432.834,728.833,912.72Net Profit (₹ Crore)595.10174.06671.99324.67174.06EPS19.705.4522.5710.575.45In terms of cash flow, the company generated ₹2,463 Crore from operating activities for the year ending March 2025. While investing activities resulted in an outflow of ₹2,637 Crore, the overall net cash flow was -₹871 Crore. These figures provide insights into the company's cash management practices and its investment strategies. The balance sheet reveals that Coromandel International has total assets worth ₹18,927 Crore, with fixed assets valued at ₹4,250 Crore and current assets at ₹13,230 Crore. The company's total liabilities stand at ₹18,927 Crore, reflecting its financial obligations and its ability to meet its financial commitments.

title: GHCL Ltd final dividend ex-date due today; Rs 12 per share payout due
content: GHCL Ltd announced a final dividend of ₹12 per share. The ex-date for this dividend is due today, July 16, 2025. The company's last traded price was ₹623.80, a 2.02% increase compared to the previous day's close. The market capitalization of GHCL Ltd stands at ₹5992.97 Crore.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹12.00Ex-DateJuly 16, 2025Payment Date17 Jul 2025Historical Context: Guj Heavy Chem has consistently distributed dividends to its shareholders. The dividend per share has varied over the years. In March 2021, the dividend was ₹5.50 per share, which increased to ₹15.00 in March 2022 and further to ₹17.50 in March 2023. In March 2024, the dividend was ₹12.00 per share. The dividend declared in March 2025 remains at ₹12.00 per share, indicating a stable dividend payout.
