title: Samvardhana Motherson International shares rise 2.07% in Tuesday's session
content: Shares of Samvardhana Motherson International gained 2.07% to trade at Rs 155.39 in Tuesday's session. The stock is part of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. The rise reflects a positive movement compared to its previous close. On July 7, 2025, Samvardhana Motherson International Limited submitted a certificate under Regulation 74(5) of SEBI (DP) Regulations, 2018 to the exchange. Earlier, on May 29, 2025, the company's board approved a bonus issue in the ratio of 1:2. Samvardhana Motherson International announced a final dividend of Rs 0.35 per share on May 29, 2025, which was 35%, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share, which was 50%, was announced on March 21, 2025, and became effective on March 28, 2025. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 29,316.83 Crore, compared to Rs 27,058.22 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 983.33 Crore, while in the quarter-ending March 2024, it was Rs 1,367.48 Crore. The EPS for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 1.49, compared to Rs 2.02 for the quarter-ending March 2024. Here is a detailed quarterly financial performance:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 27,058.22 CroreRs 28,867.96 CroreRs 27,811.86 CroreRs 27,665.92 CroreRs 29,316.83 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,367.48 CroreRs 989.12 CroreRs 764.58 CroreRs 881.19 CroreRs 983.33 CroreEPS2.021.471.291.251.49The consolidated yearly income statement shows consistent growth. Sales increased from Rs 57,369 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 113,662 Crore in March 2025. Total income rose from Rs 57,599 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 114,220 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also saw a significant increase, from Rs 1,157 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,618 Crore in March 2025. The company’s financial ratios indicate stability and growth. The debt-to-equity ratio decreased from 0.85 in March 2021 to 0.42 in March 2025. The return on net worth/equity increased from 8.27% in March 2021 to 10.90% in March 2025. The P/E ratio decreased from 40.82 in March 2021 to 23.81 in March 2025. Here is a summary of key financial ratios:RatioMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Basic EPS (Rs.)3.292.502.214.015.50Book Value /Share (Rs.)52.5149.5035.9841.6449.57Debt to Equity (x)0.850.620.540.660.42Return on Equity (%)8.274.246.6610.3810.90Moneycontrol's sentiment analysis, conducted on July 8, 2025, indicated a bullish outlook for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 155.39, Samvardhana Motherson International has demonstrated a positive movement in today's session.

title: Nippon Life India Asset Management shares hit 52-week high, gain 2.20%
content: Shares of Nippon Life India Asset Management reached a 52-week high of Rs 828 on the BSE and were trading at Rs 827.50, up 2.20 percent in Tuesday's session. The stock achieved this milestone at 11:00 am, reflecting positive investor sentiment. Financial Performance: Nippon Life India Asset Management has demonstrated robust financial performance over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth, with revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reaching Rs 2,230.69 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 1,643.22 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, climbing to Rs 1,285.73 Crore in the year-ending March 2025 from Rs 1,106.25 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 17.71 in March 2024 to Rs 20.34 in March 2025. The quarterly performance also reflects strong financials. For the quarter-ending March 2025, the company reported a revenue of Rs 566.54 Crore and a net profit of Rs 298.32 Crore. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares snap losing streak; stock among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Tata Consultancy Services snaps its losing streak, emerging as one of the top gainers on Nifty 50 in Tuesday's trading session. Investor interest post recent weakness pushed the stock into positive territory. Here's a look at the company's recent financial performance: Consolidated Financial Performance (Quarterly) Tata Consultancy Services' quarterly financial performance shows consistent revenue and net profit growth.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437.00 Crore, while in the previous quarter ending June 2024, it was Rs 62,613.00 Crore. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 12,819.00 Crore, compared to Rs 12,105.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. The EPS increased to 35.27 in June 2025 from 33.28 in June 2024. Consolidated Financial Performance (Yearly) The yearly financial performance demonstrates consistent growth in revenue, net profit and EPS.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 164,177.00 CroreRs 191,754.00 CroreRs 225,458.00 CroreRs 240,893.00 CroreRs 255,324.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562.00 CroreRs 38,449.00 CroreRs 42,303.00 CroreRs 46,099.00 CroreRs 48,797.00 CroreEPS86.71103.62115.19125.88134.19BVPS235.43245.48249.20252.26261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The revenue for the year ending March 2025 increased to Rs 255,324.00 Crore from Rs 240,893.00 Crore in the year ending March 2024. title: LTIMindtree shares rise 2.01% in today's session
content: Shares of LTIMindtree gained 2.01% to trade at Rs 5,261.50 in Tuesday's trading session. The stock demonstrated positive movement, trading at this price at 11:00 am.Financial SnapshotHere's a look at the consolidated financial performance of LTIMindtree:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 8,892.90 CroreRs 9,142.60 CroreRs 9,432.90 CroreRs 9,660.90 CroreRs 9,771.70 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,100.70 CroreRs 1,135.10 CroreRs 1,251.60 CroreRs 1,086.70 CroreRs 1,128.60 CroreEPS37.1638.3042.2536.6538.10The company has demonstrated steady growth in revenue over the past five quarters, with revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 reaching Rs 9,771.70 Crore. This represents an increase from Rs 8,892.90 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw fluctuations, with the highest profit recorded in September 2024 at Rs 1,251.60 Crore.Annual Financial PerformanceThe annual consolidated financial performance provides further insights:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,369.80 CroreRs 15,668.70 CroreRs 33,183.00 CroreRs 35,517.00 CroreRs 38,008.10 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,938.20 CroreRs 2,298.50 CroreRs 4,410.30 CroreRs 4,584.60 CroreRs 4,602.00 CroreEPS110.98131.19149.07154.85155.29BVPS417.55504.02560.78676.56766.83ROE26.5026.0526.5622.8920.26Debt to Equity0.010.090.010.000.00Annual revenue has steadily increased, reaching Rs 38,008.10 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 12,369.80 Crore in 2021. title: Balkrishna Industries shares gain 0.64% amid high volume in today's session
content: Shares of Balkrishna Industries were up 0.64 percent in Tuesday's trading session, with the stock currently trading at Rs 2,666.70. The stock demonstrated positive movement amid high volume. On July 15, 2025, Balkrishna Industries announced compliance with Regulation 74(5) of SEBI (DP) Regulations, 2018, supported by certificates from M/s. Kfin Technologies Limited for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Also, the company's board considered dividend, fixing July 12, 2025, as the record date for final dividend entitlement for the financial year ended March 31, 2025, with payment post-July 26, 2025, subject to AGM approval. Balkrishna Industries' financial performance shows a strong growth trajectory. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 2,752.38 Crore, compared to Rs 2,681.92 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 368.55 Crore, down from Rs 486.75 Crore in the previous year. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 19.06 in March 2025, lower than Rs 25.18 in March 2024. Here's a summary of Balkrishna Industries' quarterly financial performance:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 2,681.92 CroreRs 2,714.50 CroreRs 2,419.74 CroreRs 2,560.33 CroreRs 2,752.38 CroreNet ProfitRs 486.75 CroreRs 489.99 CroreRs 346.94 CroreRs 449.48 CroreRs 368.55 CroreEPS25.1825.3517.9523.2519.06The company's annual financial performance also reflects growth. Revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 10,446.95 Crore, an increase from Rs 9,368.87 Crore in March 2024. Net profit increased to Rs 1,654.96 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,471.49 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also rose from Rs 76.12 in March 2024 to Rs 85.61 in March 2025. title: Neutral Axis Bank; target of Rs 1300: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Axis Bank Axis Bank’s (AXSB) stock has significantly underperformed key private peers, led by concerns on muted growth, elevated credit cost, and a decline in RoE. The bank is strategically shifting toward secured, better yielding segments amid a cautious stance on unsecured retail and aims to outpace system growth by ~3% CAGR over the coming years. AXSB continues to focus on strengthening its liability franchise and is witnessing strong traction in the NTB (new to bank) segment. With digital initiatives, branch expansion, and a supportive LCR framework, we estimate deposits to post a 13% CAGR over FY25-27. Margins are likely to remain under pressure in the near term, driven by the transmission of repo rate cuts and slower unsecured loan growth. However, a wellmatched ALM duration will help make the impact more manageable. The bank continues to guide for through-cycle NIMs of 3.8%. Cost ratios remain higher compared to peers. While AXSB remains focused on building a stronger and more sustainable franchise—and will continue making necessary business investments—we expect positive operating jaws to emerge from FY27. Outlook While the stock trades at reasonable valuations and the risk-reward appears favorable, clarity on the trajectory of credit costs, margins, and growth remains key for a sustained performance. We estimate AXSB to deliver FY27 RoA/RoE of 1.74%/15.3%. Reiterate Neutral with a TP of INR1,300 (1.6x FY27E ABV + INR127 for subs). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Axis Bank - 15072025 - moti

title: Ola Electric, Mankind Pharma among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of several companies experienced declines in today's trading session, positioning them among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Ola Electric's stock declines 2%, taking a u-turn after a positive open. Shares of Mankind Pharma shares also declined nearly 2%. IDFC First Bank and Ashok Leyland were also among the notable losers on the index. Mankind Pharma Ltd's board is scheduled to convene on July 31, 2025, to consider and potentially approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. The board will also evaluate the declaration of an interim dividend, if any, for the financial year 2025-26. title: Hindustan Unilever shares rebound from intra-day low
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading flat in Tuesday's session. This comes as the stock touched a day's high of Rs 2,529.70. The stock has seen a recovery from intra-day lows. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents a summary of Hindustan Unilever's key financial figures:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 15,210.00 CroreRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,561.00 CroreRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreEPS10.8911.1111.0312.7010.48The consolidated revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 15,670.00 Crore, slightly down from Rs 15,818.00 Crore in the previous quarter (December 2024). The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,476.00 Crore, also lower than the Rs 2,988.00 Crore reported in the previous quarter. Earnings per share (EPS) decreased to 10.48 in March 2025 from 12.70 in December 2024. Annual Financial Performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company's consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth, reaching Rs 63,121.00 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to Rs 61,896.00 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also increased to Rs 10,679.00 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 10,286.00 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) rose from 43.74 in 2024 to 45.32 in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) stands at 21.55 for March 2025, up from 20.06 in March 2024. The company maintains a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 for the year ending March 2025. Hindustan Unilever Ltd has informed BSE that the meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company is scheduled on 31/07/2025 ,inter alia, to consider and approve Unaudited Standalone and Consolidated Financial Results for the quarter ended 30th June, 2025 along with the Limited Review Reports of the Auditors for the corresponding period. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share (2400%) on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Hindustan Unilever had a stock split on July 3, 2000, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading flat in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,515.

title: HDFC Asset Management Company shares rise 2.05% in morning trade
content: Shares of HDFC Asset Management Company increased by 2.05% to trade at Rs 5,196 at 10:45 am on Tuesday. This rise reflects positive investor sentiment during the trading session. Financial Snapshot: HDFC Asset Management Company's consolidated financial performance reveals growth across key metrics. The company's revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 901.36 Crore, compared to Rs 695.43 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period amounted to Rs 638.46 Crore, up from Rs 540.84 Crore in March 2024. title: This deal will hopefully inspire other companies to invest more in innovation: Glenn Saldanha
content: Mumbai-based drugmaker Glenmark Pharmaceuticals announced on July 10 one of the largest global licensing deals for an Indian-origin biotech asset. ISB 2001, a cancer (multiple myeloma) treatment developed by Glenmark’s US-based subsidiary Ichnos Glenmark Innovation (IGI), has been licensed to US pharma major AbbVie for $700 million (Rs 6,000 crore) upfront. IGI could earn up to $1.225 billion in additional milestone payments based on the progress of the drug through clinical trials and regulatory pathway. The company will also receive double-digit royalties on sales, once the drug is commercialised in the US, Europe, China and Japan. In an interview with Moneycontrol on July 14, Glenn Saldanha, Chairman and Managing Director of Glenmark, discussed the company's transformative deal with AbbVie, future pipeline, strategic financial deployment, and global therapeutic area leadership. Saldanha said that partnering with AbbVie has “de-risked” the company and made the R&D unit self-sufficient and self-sustaining for at least 3-4 years. The money would help IGI to develop many more assets, which can then be licensed out. Saldanha said he hasn’t yet fully figured out how to deploy much of the proceeds of the licensing deal, but added that he would be careful. “My experience tells me one wrong move can set you back 4-5 years. So, we need to be very careful," he said. Glenmark has a net debt of around Rs 400 crore. Glenmark is India’s 11th largest pharma company by market capitalisation and 12th by FY25 revenue. The company has revenue of Rs. 13,322 and net profit Rs. 1,047 crore (FY25). It's latest market capitalisation is Rs 61,370.21 crore. Edited excerpts:. Q: Congratulations on the AbbVie deal. Could you clarify the deal's big payout? Given the inherent uncertainties in drug development, how optimistic are you about receiving the milestone payments? Saldanha: Thank you. The deal includes a significant $700-million upfront payment, which is already in the bank. Beyond that, there's a potential for an additional $1.2 billion in milestone payments. Well, honestly, I can't say with certainty. Drug development is inherently risky. In our 25 years, we've had many molecules, but none made it to the market, so failure is part of the game. The only guarantee we have is the $700-million upfront payment. That's for sure. Everything else depends on how clinical trials progress. We'll receive milestones as they cross certain phases. These include clinical, regulatory, and even sales-linked milestones. Then there are potentially substantial double-digit royalties, which could be truly transformational and act like an annuity for 15-20 years, making the numbers very big. Q: What does this mean for Glenmark’s financials and future direction? Saldanha: Effectively, by partnering, we've passed on the risk and de-risked ourselves. We've taken some money off the table. Crucially, we've retained the rights for emerging markets, including India. So, we've basically de-risked part of the asset by partnering with a big pharma and effectively monetising it. Q: Can you provide an update on the clinical trials of the drug (ISB 2001)? Where are they being conducted? How long will it take to cross the finish line? Saldanha: The clinical trials are already underway. We're currently in Phase 1B, conducting a dose expansion trial. The trials are primarily being conducted in the US, Australia, and Europe – those three geographies. Typically, assets at this stage, if you look at comparable ones, take about 3-5 years to get to commercialisation, even with fast-track approvals. Q: What was the reception like for the scientific presentations on this drug at conferences? Saldanha: Our first major presentation was an oral one at ASH, the American Society of Hematology, which is a big platform. Everyone really got excited by the clinical data. We followed it up with a presentation at American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) in May. By that point, we already had a number of companies showing super interest in licensing this asset. The clinical response rates have been quite remarkable. For a drug at this stage, with 30-40 patients dosed, we saw a 79 percent overall response rate. This means patients who had exhausted almost all other lines of therapy, including bispecifics, chimeric antigen receptors (CAR)-T cell therapy, and antibody drug conjugates (ADCs), showed a response. And what's even more impressive is that 30 percent of them achieved complete remission, meaning they are cancer-free. Q: Can you tell us more about the BEAT platform, the core of Glenmark's multispecific antibody therapy? Saldanha: Certainly. Historically, antibodies on the market, like Darzalex or Humira, are monoclonal antibodies. They mimic the body's natural antibodies and bind to a single site. What we've done with our BEAT (Bispecific Engagement by Antibodies based on the T cell receptor) platform is to re-engineer some of these structures. We essentially changed some of the DNA sequences and protein structures in the Y-shaped antibody. So, a bispecific means you're replacing two ends of the antibody, and a trispecific means three ends. This allows it to bind to multiple sites. For example, one end can engage T-cells, and the other can engage the tumor. With trispecifics, you're adding a third variant, so, say, two will bind to the tumor and one to the T-lymphocytes to bring them to the tumour and kill it. These are all genetically engineered antibodies. The BEAT technology was developed as a 'plug-and-play' platform. We started with bispecifics and then further modified it to create tri- and multispecifics. Having multiple binding sites makes it much more powerful. In oncology, patients often progress through different therapies. For instance, in multiple myeloma, they might start with a monoclonal, then move to a bispecific, and when the tumor reinvents itself, you can introduce a trispecific. This forces the tumor to deal with three different binding sites, effectively prolonging the patient's life, as there's no ultimate cure for cancer. Q: What other assets are in Glenmark's multispecific antibody pipeline using the BEAT platform? Are they focused only on hematology? Saldanha: We've only disclosed one additional near-term asset, which is 2301. While 2001 is a T-cell engager, 2301 is an NK cell engager. It's also a multispecific antibody, and we're hoping to get that into clinics next calendar year. It's a very exciting asset. We have a couple of other early-stage multispecific antibody programmes as well, but it's too early to talk about them. And no, these are going beyond hematology; we're also targeting solid tumors. Q: How will this deal transform Glenmark Pharmaceuticals, particularly regarding its subsidiary IGI? Saldanha: This deal is transformative. IGI was heavily dependent on Glenmark for funding, burning about $70 million a year, which was a huge drag on Glenmark's P&L and balance sheet. With $700 million coming in, IGI will be self-sufficient and self-sustaining for at least the 3-4 years. Plus, some of that money will come back to the parent company for our investments in IGI, through dividends and so on. This means that within the 3-4 years, IGI will be able to develop many more assets, which can then be partnered out, leveraging the technology much more effectively. Q: How does Glenmark plan to deploy the $700-million upfront payment? Are there any M&A plans? Saldanha: M&A is not on the cards for at least the next year or two. After that, we'll evaluate. In-licensing, however, is something we continuously explore. For example, we did deals with Jiangsu Alphamab Biopharmaceuticals and 3D Medicines (Beijing) for the cancer drug, KN035 (Envafolimab). We're commercialising Envafolimab for all emerging markets. We also in-licensed Winlevi in Europe and Abrocitinib from Pfizer in India. This is part of our strategy to expand and leverage our global distribution. Regarding the capital, it will primarily sit as cash on our books, helping to de-leverage. We're taking our time to regroup and strategically figure out how to deploy this capital. My experience tells me one wrong move can set you back four or five years, so we need to be very careful. Q: What are Glenmark’s core therapeutic focus areas?Saldanha: Globally, we are focused on dermatology, and the respiratory and oncology segments. In India, we also have cardiovascular segment and are entering the diabetes segment with GLP-1s. But we don’t define ourselves by market rank. For us, it’s about dominating certain therapies globally. Q: What are the biggest challenges for Indian pharma companies in drug innovation, compared to global players, and what can be done to accelerate it? Saldanha: I've spent 25 years of my life to get to just one (ISB) 2001. Innovation is a global game, and you're competing with the biggest players in the industry – all the big pharmas with deep pockets, huge resources, and the best knowledge base. It's not an easy game to play, and India has a lot of work ahead to keep replicating these successes. Hopefully, this deal will inspire other companies to invest more in innovation. China has achieved a lot, largely due to immense government support. Here, it's largely the private sector , and it's extremely difficult to balance capital market expectations, short-term quarterly profits, and long-term investment. The de-risking mechanism is largely through licensing. There's hardly any VC money flowing into India for smaller biotechs to fund their research. Q: Are you preparing any succession plan for the company?Saldanha: I think it's still early. But I think, I mean, this is it. It's a boring business. I mean, we run a boring business. We can't generate that much news… Next gen will come at some point, right? The question is, for now, it's... I'm still young, so I think I still have some time. I'm 55 now, so I have some runway.
summary_lexrank: Saldanha: The clinical trials are already underway.
summary_luhn: ISB 2001, a cancer (multiple myeloma) treatment developed by Glenmark’s US-based subsidiary Ichnos Glenmark Innovation (IGI), has been licensed to US pharma major AbbVie for $700 million (Rs 6,000 crore) upfront.
summary_lsa: Then there are potentially substantial double-digit royalties, which could be truly transformational and act like an annuity for 15-20 years, making the numbers very big.
summary_textrank: With trispecifics, you're adding a third variant, so, say, two will bind to the tumor and one to the T-lymphocytes to bring them to the tumour and kill it.

title: Bandhan Bank, Syngene Intl among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: In Tuesday's trading session, several stocks demonstrated strong performance within the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 10:30 am, Bandhan Bank, Syngene Intl, Blue Star, Escorts Kubota, and KEI Industries were identified as top gainers. Shares of Bandhan Bank led the gains with a 3.15% increase, trading at Rs 180.65. Syngene Intl followed, rising by 2.94% to Rs 655.00. Blue Star's stock price increased by 2.85% to Rs 1,880.60, while Escorts Kubota saw a 2.5% gain, reaching Rs 3,346.00. KEI Industries shares also performed well, increasing by 2.16% to Rs 3,813.20. Syngene Intl Financials Syngene International's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. title: UPL shares rise 2.08%; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of UPL gained 2.08% to trade at Rs 673.25 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. This marks a positive movement from its previous close. UPL's financial performance reveals key insights. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 15,573 Crore, compared to Rs 14,078 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,106 Crore, a significant increase from the net loss of Rs -125 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 11.42 for March 2025, up from Rs 0.52 in March 2024. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 46,637 Crore, up from Rs 43,098 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year was Rs 1,292 Crore, recovering from a net loss of Rs -1,636 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's EPS was Rs 9.85 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs -17.80 in the previous year. The book value per share (BVPS) increased to Rs 367.46 in March 2025, from Rs 330.76 in March 2024. The debt-to-equity ratio improved to 0.81 in March 2025, from 1.15 in March 2024. title: Mid, smallcap indices gain for 2nd day, outperform benchmarks; here are the top gainers
content: The Nifty Midcap 100 and Nifty Smallcap 100 indices advanced for the second consecutive session on Tuesday, outperforming benchmark indices on sustained buying interest in select counters including Godfrey Phillips, Bandhan Bank among others. The Nifty Smallcap 100 index rose nearly 2 percent over two sessions, while the Nifty Midcap 100 added more than 1 percent during the same period. Both indices outpaced the headline indices for the second day in a row. Sensex and Nifty rebounded in early trade after a four-day losing streak, supported by easing retail inflation and positive global cues. Retail inflation fell to a 6-year low of 2.1 percent in June, approaching the Reserve Bank of India's comfort range. Gains in Wall Street overnight also aided sentiment. In early trade, the Sensex climbed 203.95 points to 82,457.41, while the broader Nifty gained 68.85 points to 25,151.15. On Monday, the Sensex had declined 247.01 points or 0.30 percent to settle at 82,253.46. The Nifty closed lower by 67.55 points or 0.27 percent at 25,082.30. Among smallcap stocks, Godfrey Phillips India emerged as the top gainer on the Nifty Smallcap 100 index, rising nearly 6 percent to Rs 9,561 per share on the NSE. Swan Energy and Piramal Pharma followed, gaining 2.56 percent and 2.53 percent, respectively. Other notable gainers included PG Electroplast, Devyani International, Amber Enterprises and RailTel Corporation of India, which rose in the range of 1 to 2.5 percent. In the midcap segment, Bandhan Bank led gains on the Nifty Midcap 100 index, rising 3.36 percent to Rs 181.03 per share. Escorts Kubota, Tata Elxsi, PI Industries and HDFC Asset Management Company also posted gains, rising up to 2 percent. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The Nifty Midcap 100 and Nifty Smallcap 100 indices advanced for the second consecutive session on Tuesday, outperforming benchmark indices on sustained buying interest in select counters including Godfrey Phillips, Bandhan Bank among others.
summary_luhn: Among smallcap stocks, Godfrey Phillips India emerged as the top gainer on the Nifty Smallcap 100 index, rising nearly 6 percent to Rs 9,561 per share on the NSE.
summary_lsa: Escorts Kubota, Tata Elxsi, PI Industries and HDFC Asset Management Company also posted gains, rising up to 2 percent.
summary_textrank: Among smallcap stocks, Godfrey Phillips India emerged as the top gainer on the Nifty Smallcap 100 index, rising nearly 6 percent to Rs 9,561 per share on the NSE.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares trade flat in today's session; over 2.7 lakh shares traded
content: Hindustan Unilever shares were trading flat in today's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,517.50, reflecting a marginal increase of 0.04% on the NSE. As of 10:20 am, the stock saw 279,370 shares traded. In terms of quarterly financial performance, Hindustan Unilever reported a revenue of Rs 15,670 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The company's net profit for the same period stood at Rs 2,476 Crore, with an Earnings Per Share (EPS) of Rs 10.48. Here's a more detailed look at Hindustan Unilever's consolidated quarterly financials:HeadingMar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Mar 2024RevenueRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,210.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,561.00 CroreEPS10.4812.7011.0311.1110.89The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 15,670 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 15,818 Crore reported in the previous quarter of December 2024. The net profit also saw a decrease, from Rs 2,988 Crore in December 2024 to Rs 2,476 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, the EPS decreased from Rs 12.70 to Rs 10.48 over the same period. Examining the yearly financial performance, Hindustan Unilever's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 63,121 Crore. The net profit for the same period was Rs 10,679 Crore, with an EPS of Rs 45.32. Here's a more detailed look at Hindustan Unilever's consolidated yearly financials:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 63,121.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 47,028.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 10,679.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 8,000.00 CroreEPS45.3243.7443.0737.7934.03BVPS210.22217.95214.99208.88202.95ROE21.5520.0620.1118.0916.77Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual revenue saw an increase from Rs 61,896 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 63,121 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also increased from Rs 10,286 Crore to Rs 10,679 Crore, and EPS increased from Rs 43.74 to Rs 45.32 over the same period. Hindustan Unilever's Board of Directors is scheduled to meet on July 31, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Hindustan Unilever Ltd has announced a final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share which was announced on April 24, 2025 with effective date of June 23, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,517.50, Hindustan Unilever shows a marginal increase in today's trading session with over 2.7 lakh shares traded.

title: ITC shares gain in today's session; over 21.5 lakh shares traded

title: Sell Tata Technologies; target of Rs 510: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on Tata Technologies Tata Technologies’ (TATATECH) revenue declined 7.6% QoQ CC in its core services segment. Growth was impacted as OEMs delayed ramp-ups and paused R&D spends amid tariff-led challenges. Management is optimistic of a recovery from Q2 on the back of a healthy order book (OB) at end-Q1. Even with the envisaged recovery from next quarter, FY26 growth would likely be weak growth year, in our view. In contrast to management’s double-digit revenue growth aspiration, we model a 1.5% YoY USD dip in FY26. TATATECH aims to maintain its FY26 EBIT margin akin to FY25; a tall order, in our view, given the feeble revenue growth. Outlook We continue to value TATATECH at 25x on Q3FY27E to Q2FY28E EPS of INR 20 to arrive at a TP of INR 510. We maintain SELL given rich valuations and the slow recovery from challenges in the automotive segment. title: Hold HCL Technologies; target of Rs 1550: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on HCL Technologies The revenue growth performance was tad below our estimates, largely attributed to the P&P business (down 7.1% QoQ CC), while Service business growth was flat CC QoQ despite macro volatility. The revenue guidance improvement at the lower band by 100bps eliminates the odds of hitting the worst, while improved discretionary spends on Financial Service and Technology verticals further boosts management confidence to deliver growth within the guidance band. However, the tariff sensitive verticals (Manufacturing, Retail, Healthcare) continue to see execution deferrals and slowdown in decision making, which might pose additional risk to achieve the upper end of the guidance. ER&D vertical continued to be on a weak footing, down 0.5% QoQ CC, due to weakness in Automotive and Life Science, which create additional growth headwinds. Despite the fact, the management is doubling down on AI investments and fuel S&M engines to drive differentiated offerings through agentic AI. Hence, the company is consciously taking a margin hit in the near-term, lowering margin guidance to 17-18% (18-19% earlier), to secure long-term growth. We are baking revenue growth of 3.4% and 5.8% YoY CC over FY26E & FY27E respectively, while expecting a decline in margins of 80bps YoY in FY26E followed by an improvement of 80bps in FY27E. Post the near-term correction, the stock is currently trading at 25x/22x FY26E/FY27E, hence we upgrade to HOLD (earlier REDUCE). Outlook We are baking in USD revenue/Earnings CAGR of 5.8%/7.3% between FY25-27E. The stock is currently trading at a PE of 25x/22x FY26E/FY27E earnings. We are assigning a PE multiple of 21x to FY27E earnings and arrive at a TP of INR 1,550. We upgrade our rating on the stock from Reduce to HOLD. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. HCL Technologies - 15072025 - prabhu

title: HCL Tech share price falls 4%; among top losers on Nifty 50

title: Glenmark Pharma shares fall 2.12%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Glenmark Pharma declined by 2.12% to trade at Rs 2,172.10 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top losers on Nifty Midcap 150. At 10:02 am, the stock price reflected a notable decrease from its previous close. title: Motherson Sumi Wiring India shares rise 2.32% in early trade
content: Shares of Motherson Sumi Wiring India gained 2.32% to trade at Rs 64.85 in Tuesday's early session. The stock movement is reflected in the Nifty Midcap 150 index, where Motherson Sumi Wiring India is a constituent. Regarding the company's financial performance, the standalone annual income statement shows a consistent increase in sales over the past four years. For the year ending March 2025, Motherson Sumi Wiring India reported sales of Rs 9,320 Crore, up from Rs 8,328 Crore in March 2024, Rs 7,057 Crore in March 2023, and Rs 5,635 Crore in March 2022. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 605 Crore, compared to Rs 638 Crore in March 2024. The standalone quarterly income statement reveals sales of Rs 2,509 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025, compared to Rs 2,300 Crore in December 2024 and Rs 2,325 Crore in September 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 164 Crore. title: Bharti Airtel share price gains 0.74% in early trade
content: Bharti Airtel's stock is currently trading at Rs 1,935.10, a 0.74% increase from its previous close, in Tuesday's session. At 09:30 am, the stock is showing positive movement in early trading. The company's net profit has also significantly improved, with a profit of Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025 compared to a loss of Rs 23,327.90 Crore in 2021. Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16 per share on May 13, 2025, with the effective date being July 18, 2025. Earlier dividends included Rs 8 per share on May 14, 2024, and Rs 4 per share on May 16, 2023. Bharti Airtel is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,935.10, Bharti Airtel has demonstrated a positive trend in early trading.

title: Bumper market debut: Glen Industries shares list at 62% premium to SME IPO price after 242x subscription
content: The shares of Glen Industries made a bumper market debut on July 14, listing at Rs 157 apiece on the BSE SME platform. This marks a premium of 61.86 percent over the issue price of Rs 97 per share. The listing premium is higher than the grey market estimates. Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium (GMP) of nearly 57 percent over the IPO price at Rs 152 apiece, according to data on Investorgain. The food packaging and service products maker had launched its IPO to raise Rs 63.02 crore through an entirely fresh issue of 64.96 lakh shares at a price band of Rs 92-97 per share. The maiden public issue of the company saw strong investor interest during its three day of public bidding, being subscribed a whopping 242 times between July 8 and July 10. Non institutional investors lead the subscription race, booking their reserved portion over 350 times. Retail investors and Qualified institutional investors followed, subscribing their reserved portion over 225 times and 192 times respectively. Investors could bid for a minimum of 1,200 shares, requiring an investment of Rs 1,16,400 at the upper price band, and in multiples thereafter. At the listing price, one lot of 1,200 shares would be worth Rs 1,88,400. This implies a profit of Rs 7,200 per lot for its allotted investors. On July 7, a day before the issue, Glen Industries already raised Rs 17.46 crore, a part of the IPO, via anchor book of 18 lakh shares. HDFC Bank, Aarth AIF Growth Fund, Nine Alps Trust, Sanshi Funds, Mili Capital Investment Trust, and Swyom India Alpha Fund among 12 institutional investors participated in the anchor book. The Rs 47.73-crore of IPO proceeds will be utilised for setting Up a new manufacturing facility at Jamalpur, West Bengal. And the remainder funds will be used for general corporate purpose. Follow all IPO news here. Glen Industries manufactures diverse range of food packaging and service products used primarily in the food and beverage, and food packaging industries.
summary_lexrank: The food packaging and service products maker had launched its IPO to raise Rs 63.02 crore through an entirely fresh issue of 64.96 lakh shares at a price band of Rs 92-97 per share.
summary_luhn: The food packaging and service products maker had launched its IPO to raise Rs 63.02 crore through an entirely fresh issue of 64.96 lakh shares at a price band of Rs 92-97 per share.
summary_lsa: The Rs 47.73-crore of IPO proceeds will be utilised for setting Up a new manufacturing facility at Jamalpur, West Bengal.
summary_textrank: Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium (GMP) of nearly 57 percent over the IPO price at Rs 152 apiece, according to data on Investorgain.

title: Sirca Paints: Is the market painting too rosy a picture?
content: HighlightsHighly competitive intensity, weak demandStrong performance despite industry headwinds80% of manufacturing facility automated28% market share in Delhi-NCR regionStock up more than 60% since our last recommendationTrading at 32 times FY27 earningsPaint stocks are back in focus as rising competition, driven by the entry of new players, creates uncertainty for existing market leaders. While most stocks in the sector are trading sideways as investors assess the long-term impact, Sirca Paints (CMP: Rs 419; Market Cap: Rs 2,295 crore; Rating: Overweight), a leading player in the paints and wood coatings space, has emerged as a notable out-performer. The company posted an impressive 22 percent year-on-year (YoY) revenue growth in Q4FY25, marking a strong recovery, after several quarters of muted performance and margin pressure. This turnaround has propelled the stock over 61 percent since our March 2025 recommendation to accumulate. But with competitive intensity rising and margin headwinds still a concern, the key question is: is the rally sustainable? Portfolio expansion, strategic partnership Sirca continues to diversify its product portfolio across the entry-level, economy, and luxury segments. Its partnership with Italy’s OIKOS S.P.A. has been a key growth driver, bringing in high-value, eco-friendly products with A+ air quality standards. While the high-margin decorative and luxury segments—especially OIKOS offerings—are gaining traction, the economy decorative segment is witnessing increased competition. In FY25, decorative paints, including OIKOS, contributed 7 percent to the company’s revenue. To strengthen brand visibility and customer engagement, Sirca is investing 4–5 percent of its revenue in marketing and promotions. The company is also preparing to launch ultra-premium wall paints in collaboration with OIKOS, targeting the luxury home décor segment. Additionally, Sirca is expanding its presence in emerging markets like Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, the North-East, and South India, supporting its pan-India growth ambition. Dealer expansion on track Sirca generates nearly 70 percent of its revenue from northern India. To build a stronger pan-India presence and reduce regional dependency, the company is actively expanding its dealer network across other parts of the country. As of FY25, Sirca’s dealer and distributor network has grown to over 4,000, which also includes the dealer network of its recently acquired Welcome brand. This expansion is aimed at driving growth and strengthening its position in new and under-penetrated markets. Expands capacity, eyes global export growth Sirca has expanded its Sonipat manufacturing unit’s capacity from 12,000 tonnes to 16,000 tonnes. The current capacity utilisation stands at 55-60 percent, and it is expected to reach 70-75 percent over the next 1-2 years, with a single-shift operation. Exports present a significant opportunity for Sirca, with the company targeting 20 million euros in exports to Russia, the UAE, Saudi Arabia, and Estonia for economical PU products, pending final approval from Sirca Italy for product quality checks. The current facility is well-equipped to handle export demand. Sirca plans to set up a manufacturing facility in Dahej with an estimated investment of Rs 20–25 crore, which will add an additional capacity of 16,000 tonnes. The company is also exploring inorganic growth opportunities, including potential expansion into the metal coatings segment. To support its upcoming capital expenditure plans, Sirca is raising Rs 76 crore through a preferential issue. Welcome brand to drive growth The acquisition of the Welcome brand is progressing well and is strengthening Sirca’s presence in the value segment. The addition of products like sanding sealers, lacquers, enamels, and melamine expands its portfolio to tap industrial demand. Despite weak consumer sentiment, Sirca has generated Rs 35 crore in revenue from the Welcome brand in 9MFY25. Outlook & valuations Sirca Paints has continued to show strong revenue growth, but margins have come under pressure in recent quarters due to higher dealer incentives. Going forward, we expect margins to stabilise with a better product mix and increasing contribution from the Welcome brand. The stock has seen a strong rally in the past four months and is now close to its all-time high of Rs 430. Despite rising competition, we believe Sirca can still grow at 15–20 percent annually. While the recent rally may be factoring in short-term optimism, the long-term growth story remains strong. At 32x FY27 estimated earnings, we remain positive on the company’s future.
summary_lexrank: In FY25, decorative paints, including OIKOS, contributed 7 percent to the company’s revenue.
summary_luhn: As of FY25, Sirca’s dealer and distributor network has grown to over 4,000, which also includes the dealer network of its recently acquired Welcome brand.
summary_lsa: The company posted an impressive 22 percent year-on-year (YoY) revenue growth in Q4FY25, marking a strong recovery, after several quarters of muted performance and margin pressure.
summary_textrank: Welcome brand to drive growth The acquisition of the Welcome brand is progressing well and is strengthening Sirca’s presence in the value segment.

title: Syngene International shares rise 2.45% in early trade
content: Shares of Syngene International gained 2.45% to trade at Rs 651.90 in Tuesday's session. The stock is showing positive movement in today's trade. Financial Snapshot: Syngene International's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue over the past five years. Consolidated annual revenue increased from Rs 2,184.30 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,642.40 Crore in March 2025. title: ITC shares rise marginally in early trade
content: Shares of ITC saw a slight increase in early trading, with the stock price at Rs 419.95, up 0.13% from the previous close, at 9:30 am. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent revenue and profit growth. The annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 75,323.34 Crore, compared to Rs 70,881.00 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 20,723.75 Crore reported in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) saw a significant increase, rising to Rs 27.79 in March 2025 from Rs 16.42 in March 2024. title: Hindustan Unilever shares rise marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,521.80 on the NSE, up by 0.21% in early trade. The stock’s movement comes amid ongoing trading activity on the Nifty 50 index at 09:30 am. Hindustan Unilever Ltd's board is scheduled to convene on July 31, 2025, to review and approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. In the annual financial overview, Hindustan Unilever's revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 63,121 Crore, compared to Rs 61,896 Crore in the previous year. The company's net profit also saw an increase, rising to Rs 10,679 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 10,286 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 45.32 in March 2025, up from Rs 43.74 in the previous year. The consolidated annual income statement shows sales of Rs 63,121 Crore for March 2025, compared to Rs 61,896 Crore for March 2024. Other income totaled Rs 1,017 Crore, bringing the total income to Rs 64,138 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 49,320 Crore, resulting in earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) of Rs 14,818 Crore. After accounting for interest (Rs 395 Crore) and tax (Rs 3,744 Crore), the net profit was reported as Rs 10,679 Crore. The company’s financial performance can be further examined through its key financial ratios. The Basic Earnings Per Share (EPS) for March 2025 was Rs 45.32, compared to Rs 43.74 for March 2024. The Book Value per Share (BVPS) was Rs 210.22 in March 2025. The company's Return on Net Worth (ROE) was 21.55% for March 2025, up from 20.06% in the previous year. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of March 2025. The Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio stood at 49.84, and the Price-to-Book (P/B) ratio was 10.75. Here is a summary of Hindustan Unilever's key financial data:FinancialsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue (Rs Crore)15,670.0015,818.0015,926.0015,707.0015,210.00Net Profit (Rs Crore)2,476.002,988.002,601.002,614.002,561.00EPS10.4812.7011.0311.1110.89Furthermore, Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,521.80, Hindustan Unilever shows a marginal gain in today's early trading session.

title: Hero Motocorp stock among top gainers on Nifty 50, up 1.7% in early trade
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp led the gains on the Nifty 50 in Tuesday's early trading session. At 09:30 am, the stock was trading at Rs 4,323.90, a 1.7% increase from its previous close, positioning it as a top performer on the index. Other notable gainers on the Nifty 50 included Sun Pharma (up 1.47% to Rs 1,707.30), IndusInd Bank (up 0.97% to Rs 876.05), Shriram Finance (up 0.92% to Rs 675.90), and Bajaj Auto (up 0.85% to Rs 8,156.50).Hero Motocorp Financial OverviewHere's a look at the key financial performance indicators for Hero Motocorp:Consolidated Quarterly ResultsThe following table presents the consolidated quarterly results for Hero Motocorp over the last five quarters:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 9,616.68 CroreRs 10,210.79 CroreRs 10,482.93 CroreRs 10,259.89 CroreRs 9,969.81 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,018.03 CroreRs 1,086.35 CroreRs 1,152.75 CroreRs 1,200.12 CroreRs 1,097.71 CroreEPS46.7852.3153.1955.3858.08The revenue for Hero Motocorp has shown a fluctuating trend over the past five quarters, with a peak in September 2024 at Rs 10,482.93 Crore and a slight decrease to Rs 9,969.81 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also varied, reaching its highest in December 2024 at Rs 1,200.12 Crore, before dropping to Rs 1,097.71 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) increased steadily, peaking at 58.08 in March 2025.Consolidated Yearly ResultsThe following table presents the consolidated yearly results for Hero Motocorp over the last five years:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 30,959.19 CroreRs 29,551.28 CroreRs 34,158.38 CroreRs 37,788.62 CroreRs 40,923.42 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,982.61 CroreRs 2,528.10 CroreRs 2,796.79 CroreRs 3,862.41 CroreRs 4,536.93 CroreEPS146.07115.96140.62187.36218.96BVPS778.76800.54839.66892.17963.60ROE18.9214.6216.8721.1522.71Debt to Equity0.020.020.020.020.02The yearly data reveals consistent growth in revenue from 2021 to 2025, with revenue increasing from Rs 30,959.19 Crore to Rs 40,923.42 Crore. The book value per share (BVPS) has steadily grown from Rs 778.76 to Rs 963.60, and the return on equity (ROE) has improved from 18.92% to 22.71%. The company has declared a final dividend of Rs.65.00 per share (3250%) with an effective date of July 24, 2025. The company had announced an interim dividend of Rs.100.00 per share (5000%) with effective date February 12, 2025. The company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus ratio on August 4, 1998. Additionally, the stock underwent a split on March 12, 2001, with the face value changing from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Hero Motocorp's stock performance reflects its strong market position, with the stock trading at Rs 4,323.90 in early trade, marking it among the top gainers on the Nifty 50.

title: Tejas Networks shares slip 11% as Q1 loss, revenue slump spook investors
content: Shares of Tejas Networks dropped as much as 11 percent to Rs 627 on July 15 before trimming losses to trade over 5 percent lower, after the company reported a sharp loss for the June quarter. The sell-off was triggered by weak earnings, with the company slipping to a consolidated net loss of Rs 193.9 crore in Q1 FY26, compared to a net profit of Rs 77.5 crore in the same period last year. The disappointing performance, driven by a steep decline in revenue and operational metrics, weighed on investor sentiment. Revenue plunged 87 percent year-on-year to Rs 211 crore, down from Rs 1,563 crore in Q1 FY25, largely due to delayed purchase orders and shipment clearances, especially related to the BSNL 4G rollout. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates On a sequential basis, revenue was down 89 percent. The company also reported an EBITDA loss of Rs 126.6 crore, with margins crashing to -60 percent from 10.9 percent a year earlier. “The revenue shortfall was primarily due to delays in order receipts, including from BSNL,” said COO Arnob Roy, adding that Tejas secured orders for routers under BharatNet Phase 3 and optical equipment from private operators in India. Also read: HCL Technologies shares slip on weaker-than-expected Q1 show; should you buy, sell, or hold? CFO Sumit Dhingra said the bottom line was impacted by lower topline performance but noted that the order book stood at Rs 1,241 crore—up 22 percent quarter-on-quarter. He added that a Rs 1,526 crore RAN equipment order linked to BSNL’s expansion is expected soon. At about 9:45 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 660, lower by 5.5 percent from the last close on the NSE. Tejas Networks' shares have been on a tough run, falling 45 percent since the start of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Revenue plunged 87 percent year-on-year to Rs 211 crore, down from Rs 1,563 crore in Q1 FY25, largely due to delayed purchase orders and shipment clearances, especially related to the BSNL 4G rollout.
summary_luhn: The sell-off was triggered by weak earnings, with the company slipping to a consolidated net loss of Rs 193.9 crore in Q1 FY26, compared to a net profit of Rs 77.5 crore in the same period last year.

title: Coforge Ltd shares rise 2.09% in early trade
content: At 9:31 am on Tuesday, COFORGE LIMITED shares were trading at Rs 1,914.10, a rise of 2.09% on the NSE. The stock is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,409.90 Crore, up from Rs 2,358.50 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 307.30 Crore, compared to Rs 229.20 Crore in the previous year. The following table summarizes the key financial data:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 2,358.50 CroreRs 2,400.80 CroreRs 3,062.30 CroreRs 3,318.20 CroreRs 3,409.90 CroreNet ProfitRs 229.20 CroreRs 139.30 CroreRs 233.60 CroreRs 255.90 CroreRs 307.30 CroreEPS36.2120.9330.3232.2639.02The annual consolidated revenue has seen a steady increase over the years. In March 2025, the revenue was Rs 12,050.70 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 9,179.00 Crore in March 2024. Similarly, the net profit increased from Rs 835.60 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 936.10 Crore in March 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 4,662.80 CroreRs 6,432.00 CroreRs 8,014.60 CroreRs 9,179.00 CroreRs 12,050.70 CroreNet ProfitRs 466.00 CroreRs 714.70 CroreRs 745.10 CroreRs 835.60 CroreRs 936.10 CroreEPS74.68109.02113.77131.56123.01BVPS406.95464.93518.81603.06953.54ROE18.4724.2122.5022.2712.73Debt to Equity0.000.130.110.120.11The company has announced several corporate actions, including the allotment of ESOP/ESPS. Additionally, the company has a history of dividend payouts, with multiple interim dividends declared. A stock split was announced on March 4, 2025, with an ex-split date of June 4, 2025, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis as of July 10, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,914.10, COFORGE LIMITED shows a positive movement in today's early trade on the NSE.

title: Tata Tech, AIA Engineering, Ola Electric, Tata Elxsi, Bandhan Bank stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 9:30 am on Tuesday, a few stocks stood out as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Tata Tech led with a 2.71% increase, followed by AIA Engineering at 2.7%, Ola Electric at 2.61%, Tata Elxsi at 2.51%, and Bandhan Bank with a gain of 2.31%. Tata Technologies (Tata Tech) is one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. AIA Engineering is another top gainer on Nifty Midcap 150. AIA Engineering’s consolidated quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating trend. It was Rs 1,150.22 Crore in March 2024, decreased to Rs 1,019.97 Crore in June 2024, increased to Rs 1,044.20 Crore in September 2024, further increased to Rs 1,066.23 Crore in December 2024, and then rose to Rs 1,157.04 Crore in March 2025. The consolidated yearly revenue shows a decrease from Rs 4,853.76 Crore in 2024 to Rs 4,287.44 Crore in 2025. The net profit figures also indicate variability. The quarterly net profit was Rs 259.72 Crore in March 2024, slightly decreased to Rs 257.97 Crore in June 2024, remained relatively stable at Rs 256.00 Crore in September 2024, marginally decreased to Rs 254.71 Crore in December 2024, and then increased to Rs 279.65 Crore in March 2025. The yearly net profit decreased from Rs 1,135.48 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,048.32 Crore in 2025. Key financial ratios also show mixed results. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) was Rs 27.63 in March 2024, slightly decreased to Rs 27.52 in June 2024, marginally decreased to Rs 27.29 in September 2024, slightly increased to Rs 27.78 in December 2024, and then increased to Rs 30.55 in March 2025. The dividend per share increased from Rs 9.00 in 2021 to Rs 16.00 in 2025. The debt to equity ratio has remained relatively stable at 0.07 as of March 2025. According to the balance sheet, the share capital has remained constant at Rs 18 Crore from March 2021 to March 2025. Reserves and surplus have increased from Rs 4,225 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 6,908 Crore in March 2025. Total assets have grown from Rs 4,758 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 7,834 Crore in March 2025. Tata Elxsi is another constituent of Nifty Midcap 150. Tata Elxsi’s standalone yearly sales have increased from Rs 1,826 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,729 Crore in March 2025. Other income has increased from Rs 39 Crore to Rs 179 Crore during the same period. Net profit has also increased from Rs 368 Crore to Rs 784 Crore. Standalone quarterly sales have increased from Rs 926 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 892 Crore in June 2025. Net profit has decreased from Rs 184 Crore to Rs 144 Crore during the same period. According to the balance sheet, the share capital has remained constant at Rs 62 Crore from March 2021 to March 2025. Reserves and surplus have increased from Rs 1,289 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 2,797 Crore in March 2025. Total assets have grown from Rs 1,716 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,585 Crore in March 2025. Bandhan Bank's standalone yearly total income has increased from Rs 14,633 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 24,914 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has increased from Rs 2,205 Crore to Rs 2,745 Crore during the same period. Standalone quarterly interest earned has increased from Rs 5,189 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 5,433 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has increased from Rs 54 Crore to Rs 317 Crore during the same period. According to the balance sheet, deposits have increased from Rs 77,972 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 151,212 Crore in March 2025. Total assets have grown from Rs 114,993 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 191,476 Crore in March 2025. Tata Tech, AIA Engineering, Ola Electric, Tata Elxsi, and Bandhan Bank emerged as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 in early trading on Tuesday.

title: Infosys shares gain 0.69% in early trade
content: Shares of Infosys were trading higher in Tuesday's early session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,581.20, up 0.69% from the previous close, as of 9:20 am. The stock is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot: Infosys's financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated figures: Quarterly Results: The company's revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 40,925 Crore, compared to Rs 37,923 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 7,038 Crore, down from Rs 7,975 Crore year-over-year. The EPS stood at Rs 16.98 in March 2025, as against Rs 19.25 in March 2024. Annual Results: The annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 162,990 Crore, an increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased to Rs 26,750 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 26,248 Crore in March 2024. The EPS rose to Rs 64.50 in March 2025, compared to Rs 63.39 in March 2024. A final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) was announced on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share (420%) was announced on October 17, 2024, and paid out on October 29, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, most recently on July 13, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. Other bonus issues were announced on April 24, 2015 (1:1), October 10, 2014 (1:1), April 14, 2006 (1:1), and April 13, 2004 (3:1). title: Sun Pharma shares rise 2% as US patent settlement clears path for Leqselvi launch; Morgan Stanley remains overweight
content: Shares of Sun Pharma rose 2 percent to Rs 1,711 in morning trade on July 15, extending their gains for a third straight session. The rally comes after the company settled a patent dispute with US-based Incyte Corporation, clearing the path for the immediate launch of LEQSELVI (deuruxolitinib) in the US. As part of the settlement, Sun will make an upfront payment along with ongoing royalties. LEQSELVI is used to treat severe alopecia areata, an autoimmune disorder that causes hair loss. The agreement stipulates that both parties will seek dismissal of the pending LEQSELVI litigation in the US District Court for the District of New Jersey. It will mutually release all claims that were or could have been raised in the litigation. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Following the development, Morgan Stanley maintained its 'Overweight' rating on Sun Pharma with a target price of Rs 1,960 per share, implying an upside potential of 16.4 percent from the last close of Rs 1,683 per share. As part of the settlement, Incyte granted Sun a limited license for non-oncology uses, including alopecia areata. The US launch and resolution of litigation are seen as positive developments, reinforcing Morgan Stanley's bullish stance. The brokerage projects Leqselvi sales at $61 million for FY26 and $83 million for FY27. Sun Pharmaceutical reported a 19 percent decline in its consolidated net profit to Rs 2,153.9 crore in the fourth quarter ended March 31, 2025. The company had posted a consolidated net profit of Rs 2,658.7 crore in the year-ago period. The earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) grew 22.4 percent to Rs 3,715.9 crore in Q4FY25, compared to Rs 3,035.15 crore in the same period, a year ago, while the margin stood at 28.7 percent against 25.3 percent YoY. Sun Pharma shares have fallen over 11 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_lsa: Shares of Sun Pharma rose 2 percent to Rs 1,711 in morning trade on July 15, extending their gains for a third straight session.
summary_textrank: The rally comes after the company settled a patent dispute with US-based Incyte Corporation, clearing the path for the immediate launch of LEQSELVI (deuruxolitinib) in the US.

title: Sensex, Nifty snap 4-day losing streak as auto, oil & gas stocks gain; India VIX eases over 1%
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex were off to a slightly positive start on July 15, snapping a four-day losing streak as auto, oil & gas stocks edged higher at open. However, any bounce back today may be more of a breather than a trend reversal, with trade tariff worries still weighing on sentiment. At about 9:25 am, the Sensex was up 150.45 points or 0.18 percent at 82,403.91, and the Nifty was up 53.70 points or 0.21 percent at 25,136.00. About 2150 shares advanced, 550 shares declined, and 136 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "President Trump's announcement of steep tariffs has injected volatility, but markets remain relatively calm as the fall hasn't been too steep. We believe the tariffs are a negotiating tactic and expect a de-escalation before the August 1 deadline, helping limit downside in equities," Devarsh Vakil, Head of Prime Research at HDFC Securities, said. Experts also say that FIIs, which have been net buyers in April, May and June, have turned net sellers in July as per the latest data. This has put pressure on large caps. Absence of institutional selling in the broader market is keeping this segment resilient despite the elevated valuations. At the open on Tuesday, sectoral indices on the NSE were trading largely in the green, indicating a positive start to the day. Nifty Auto gained 0.73 percent, while Nifty Oil & Gas rose 0.77 percent. Broader indices also saw traction, with the Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 advancing 0.61 percent and 0.87 percent, respectively. Other notable gainers included Nifty Consumer Durables (0.61 percent), Energy (0.58 percent), Pharma (0.58 percent), and Infra (0.41 percent). Banking indices posted modest gains, while FMCG and Realty were flat. Meanwhile, India VIX edged lower by 0.5 percent to 11.92, suggesting continued investor calm. Among individual stocks, HCL Tech shares slipped 3 percent after the information technology giant reported disappointing earnings for the first quarter of the current fiscal year. The IT major reported a 10 percent decline in consolidated net profit at Rs 3,843 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, as against Rs 4,257 crore in the year-ago period. However, the IT firm's consolidated revenue from operations rose eight percent to Rs 30,349 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 28,057 crore in Q1FY25. Also read: Asian Paints, Vishal Mega Mart lead MF buys in June; ICICI Bank, Infosys among top sells Shares of Sun Pharma rose over a percent, extending their gains for a third straight session. The rally comes after the company settled a patent dispute with US-based Incyte Corporation, clearing the path for the immediate launch of LEQSELVI (deuruxolitinib) in the US. Tata Technologies rose 2 percent after it reported a net profit of Rs 170.28 crore for Q1 FY26, up nearly 5 percent from Rs 162 crore in the same quarter last year. However, on a sequential basis, net profit declined by around 10 percent. Revenue from operations fell 2 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,244 crore, compared to Rs 1,269 crore in Q1 FY25. Read more: MFs pump over Rs 2,800 crore into Adani group stocks in June Structurally, market breadth remains feeble, with bulls failing to show commitment. The earlier support zone of 25,200–25,300 has now reversed into a resistance zone. A decisive break below today’s low of 25,001 could further deteriorate the technical setup. On the flip side, only a sustained move above 25,350 could signal the potential for recovery, marking this level as a key hurdle. The momentum indicator RSI has slipped below 50, for the first time in over three months, underscoring weakening bullish strength. Hero MotoCorp, IndusInd Bank, Grasim, Shriram Finance, and Bajaj Auto were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included HCL Tech, Cipla, Tata Steel, SBI Life Insurance, and ICICI Bank. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Endurance Technologies shares rise 2.12% in early trade; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Endurance Technologies shares gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 2,749.10 in early trade. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 as of 9:20 am. The quarterly financial performance of Endurance Technologies shows a consistent trend in revenue. For the quarter-ending March 2024, the company reported revenue of Rs 2,684.78 Crore, which increased to Rs 2,825.50 Crore for June 2024. The revenue further rose to Rs 2,912.66 Crore for September 2024 and remained relatively stable at Rs 2,859.16 Crore for December 2024. The latest quarter, ending March 2025, saw revenue reach Rs 2,963.49 Crore. Net profit figures also reflect a positive trajectory. The net profit for March 2024 was Rs 210.15 Crore, slightly decreasing to Rs 203.86 Crore in June 2024 and Rs 202.98 Crore in September 2024. A dip was observed in December 2024 with a net profit of Rs 184.39 Crore, but the company bounced back strongly in March 2025 with a net profit of Rs 245.13 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar pattern, starting at Rs 14.94 in March 2024, slightly declining to Rs 14.49 in June 2024 and Rs 14.43 in September 2024. The EPS decreased to Rs 13.11 in December 2024 before rising to Rs 17.43 in March 2025. Consolidated Quarterly FinancialsHeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 2,684.78 CroreRs 2,825.50 CroreRs 2,912.66 CroreRs 2,859.16 CroreRs 2,963.49 CroreNet ProfitRs 210.15 CroreRs 203.86 CroreRs 202.98 CroreRs 184.39 CroreRs 245.13 CroreEPS14.9414.4914.4313.1117.43

title: HCL Technologies shares fall 2.01% in early trade
content: Shares of HCL Technologies declined by 2.01% to Rs 1,587.20 in early trade on Tuesday. The stock's performance is in comparison to its previous close, reflecting the overall market sentiment. According to the consolidated income statement, the company’s quarterly revenue increased from Rs 28,057.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 30,349.00 Crore in June 2025. The net profit for the same period decreased from Rs 4,259.00 Crore to Rs 3,844.00 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also saw a decrease from Rs 15.70 to Rs 14.18. The company's annual performance shows a steady increase in revenue from Rs 75,379.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 117,055.00 Crore in 2025. The net profit also increased from Rs 11,169.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 17,399.00 Crore in 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) rose from Rs 41.07 in 2021 to Rs 64.16 in 2025. title: Rail Vikas Nigam shares rise 2.26% in early trade
content: Shares of Rail Vikas Nigam gained 2.26% to trade at Rs 390.95 in early trade. The stock's movement is being closely watched by investors as market activity picks up. On the financial front, Rail Vikas Nigam has demonstrated considerable performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 6,426.88 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 406.74 Crore, resulting in an EPS of Rs 2.20. In comparison, for the quarter ended March 2024, the company reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 6,714.01 Crore and a net profit of Rs 435.34 Crore, with an EPS of Rs 2.29. Here is a detailed look at Rail Vikas Nigam's quarterly financial performance:ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024RevenueRs 6,426.88 CroreRs 6,714.01 CroreNet ProfitRs 406.74 CroreRs 435.34 CroreEPSRs 2.20Rs 2.29The company's annual financial performance also provides key insights. In the previous year-ending March 2024, the company's consolidated revenue stood at Rs 21,889.23 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 1,574.47 Crore and an EPS of Rs 7.55. title: Tata Elxsi shares rise 2.10% in early trade
content: Tata Elxsi shares experienced a notable increase of 2.10% in the early trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 6,308.50. This movement reflects a positive shift from the previous day's closing, positioning the stock among the gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. Examining the financial performance of Tata Elxsi, the company's standalone income statement reveals key figures. Sales for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,729 Crore, compared to Rs 3,552 Crore in the previous year. Other income increased from Rs 121 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 179 Crore in March 2025. Total income for the same period was Rs 3,908 Crore, up from Rs 3,674 Crore. The company's total expenditure rose from Rs 2,605 Crore to Rs 2,860 Crore. Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) were reported at Rs 1,047 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 1,068 Crore recorded in the previous year. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 784 Crore, compared to Rs 792 Crore in the previous year. The company's standalone quarterly income statement provides further insights. Sales for June 2025 were Rs 892 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 926 Crore recorded in June 2024. Total income for June 2025 was Rs 930 Crore, compared to Rs 958 Crore for the same period last year. Net profit stood at Rs 144 Crore for the quarter ending June 2025, compared to Rs 184 Crore in June 2024. title: Oberoi Realty shares rise 2.21% in early trade; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Oberoi Realty gained 2.21% to trade at Rs 1,844 in Tuesday's early session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Oberoi Realty is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index.Financial SnapshotThe following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Oberoi Realty:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 1,314.77 CroreRs 1,405.16 CroreRs 1,319.89 CroreRs 1,411.08 CroreRs 1,150.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 785.21 CroreRs 582.25 CroreRs 586.95 CroreRs 615.66 CroreRs 433.01 CroreEPS21.6716.0816.2117.0111.91The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,150.14 Crore, while in the previous quarter-ending December 2024, it was Rs 1,411.08 Crore. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 433.01 Crore, compared to Rs 615.66 Crore in the quarter-ending December 2024. The EPS for March 2025 was 11.91, while in December 2024, it was 17.01. The following table presents the consolidated yearly financial performance of Oberoi Realty:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,052.58 CroreRs 2,693.97 CroreRs 4,192.58 CroreRs 4,495.79 CroreRs 5,286.27 CroreNet ProfitRs 736.04 CroreRs 807.50 CroreRs 1,684.14 CroreRs 1,917.75 CroreRs 2,217.88 CroreEPS20.3328.8052.3852.9961.21BVPS257.68286.47335.81380.76431.92ROE7.8910.0515.5913.9114.17Debt to Equity0.160.270.320.180.21The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 5,286.27 Crore, while in the previous year-ending March 2024, it was Rs 4,495.79 Crore. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2,217.88 Crore, compared to Rs 1,917.75 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The EPS for March 2025 was 61.21, while in March 2024, it was 52.99. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.21 as of the year-ending March 2025.Corporate ActionsOberoi Realty announced several corporate actions, including:Issuance of Letter of Intent in respect of Hotel Horizon Private Limited (under CIRP) on July 14, 2025.Outcome of Annual General Meeting held on July 2, 2025.Declaration of results of voting on resolutions set out in notice of 27th Annual General Meeting held on July 2, 2025.The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 2 per share (20%) on April 28, 2025, with an effective date of May 5, 2025. Prior to this, another interim dividend of Rs 2 per share was announced on January 20, 2025, with an effective date of January 24, 2025. Oberoi Realty shares saw a rise of 2.21% in early trading, trading at Rs 1,844, with the company also declaring financial results and announcing corporate actions recently.
